story:
Short Summary

We're a San Francisco based non-profit focused on building real and lasting bridges between the U.S. and Asia. We've been around for over fifty years and have a proven track record of personal transformation and social impact in our wide array of programs. Our hallmark program is one-year service fellowship in which Americans spend a year embedded in organizations and universities in Asia learning about the local context and sharing their own skills and knowledge with their host institutions. We're excited to expand the reach of our selection of fellows in the United States by creating a scholarship fund that would make this life-changing program accessible to all.

                                     

What We Need & What You Get

Our campaign is simple. We want to offer scholarships to 1/3 of our expected 24 service fellows in 2015-2016. In order to do this, we need to raise $10,000. This scholarship fund will open the door for a life changing experience for rising stars who would otherwise not have had this opportunity. By contributing to our scholarship fund, you'll be empowering a new cohort of global changemakers to inspire social change and innovation in the world. Were that not incentive enough, you'll also be able to pick up some cool swag:

  • A $25 contribution earns you a handwritten thank you card from a current VIA fellow.
  • $50 entitles you to the first-ever VIA cookbook
  • $100 means you'll have the choice of Shan bag or Cambodian krama
  • $500 gives you right to a guided tour by a VIA fellow in an Asian city of your choice (assuming there is VIA fellows present there)
This campaign is only online for ten days, so don't miss your chance to pick up one or more of these awesome perks!


The Impact

If you're not already familiar with our work, you may be wondering what the impact is of your contribution. The VIA fellowship program has a long history and as such has a time-tested legacy of impact. Here are some key indicators to demonstrate what we mean:

  • 2,000 + fellows over 50-year history
  • 40+ current partners in 8 countries
  • 50,000+ expected service hours in the 2014-2015 fellowship program
  • 25+ fellows who have gotten a PhD after VIA
  • Sample of places that fellows have worked at after VIA: USAID, World Bank, Peace Corps, Department of State, National Security Council, Oxfam, the International Labor Organization, United Nations, Wall Street Journal, Apple, Intel, Google, McKinsey, World Wildlife Fund, Wikimedia Foundation, Ford Foundation, Henry Luce Foundation, Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, Asian Development Bank, Khan Academy, Business for Social Responsibility, the International Rescue Committee, Georgetown University, University of California Berkeley, Columbia University
We intentionally place our fellows at high-impact grassroots organizations that are improving lives, one-by-one, and building stronger communities in the process. Our partners work in a wide range of fields including environmental conservation, anti-human trafficking, rural development, education, and others.
And to get a better sense of how truly transformational this experience is for our fellows, consider what some of our fellows and alumni have to say:

“My experience with VIA in China was an unfinished lesson in appreciating my place in a vast, complex world. I had the privilege of meeting people from previously inconceivable walks of life. My time with VIA shaped the best parts of who I am today."  –Deb Wang, China ‘09-’11


“VIA instilled a very real understanding that despite coming from extremely different backgrounds, there is still a very deep connection that can be found that transcends culture and language. Instead of using differences to define yourself and others, you learn to look at the similarities that connect you. This understanding is timeless." – Caroline Floyd, China ‘10-’12


"I don't know how to put into words what I'm going to take away from this experience. It has changed my life more than I could ever, ever imagine. It's brought me to thinking about careers in education, given me really strong connections to places here and to different communities, it's given me strong connections to individuals. It's an experience I would absolutely not trade for anything in the world." - Jonas Crimm, China '10-'13


"I am excited, for one, to be part of a team that's on the front lines of providing health services to people living in Myanmar, and two, I just know this experience is about to change my life. So when you're about to embark on something like that, there's no other feeling but to be really excited." - Perrie Briskin, Myanmar '14-current fellow

We hope you can get a sense of the impact of our work and how your contribution will be invested. You can learn more about us, by checking out the VIA website.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you're not able to make a contribution, there are still other ways you can support our campaign

  • Share our campaign on your favorite social media platform
  • Send a personalized email to your colleagues, friends, or family letting them know about our work and why you support it

Thank you so much for your support of VIA, and we'll look forward to engaging with you further on our campaign!

story:
AMY WALLIS

In February 2014 Amy was diagnosed with Leukaemia (cancer of the white blood cells), and so she started an aggressive treatment program to eradicate the cancer.   The program was effective, and a few (painful & difficult) months later she was in remission! Hooray!  But the rounds and round and rounds of chemotherapy continue before she can be in the clear, as do all the many side effects... and medications for the side effects.  Infections. Complications.  Amy has been a champ through all of this, working hard to stay positive, gain strength back, and even with great effort sang a concert in May!  She is amazing. 

Recently however there has been a set back.... leukaemia cells were found in her brain and spine which means radiation has been added to the complex array of treatments she is already undergoing.  The strength she was slowly getting back is gone, and healing will take many months more.... dang it. 

The Challenge...

Thankfully we live in Canada- so a lot of health care is provided, and Princess Margaret Hospital is one of the best in the world.  They are fantastic there- truly a blessing. 
But there are costs to life that just can't be paid when you are this sick, too sick to move, too fragile to work ...  but costs go on...
- Rent (even a modest rent in Kensington Market), utilities, loan repayments
- Food (eating clean with good nutrition is critical)
- Medication (there is a large monthly insurance deductible for medications)
- Pharmacy products like lotions for dry irritated skin
- Cabs to/from hospital appointments (TTC is bad for a compromised immune system, and walking is hard when your bone marrow hurts)
- Supplies to make wigs (yes, Amy is making her own wigs as a gentle hobby)
- Family (her parents live and work in BC, and their ability to visit is very important)

 

BLOW THE TOP OFF $5000 is The Goal...

We'd like to cover her basic living costs for the next 3-4 months.  So our goal is $5000 (it is listed as lower here because indiegogo charges double if the goal is not met...)  There are some prizes we will continue to offer people who contribute!  

*** 5 day UPDATE.... I'm so happy this is doing well!  Each contribution is someone who cares, as well as some extra time worry-free during the long healing process (which can take up to 2 years).... Its truly heartwarming to see such a warm and caring community of people come out to help when one of our artists ranks is sick.   You guys are the best.

***48 hour UPDATE... This is magic... we are over $10 000... and 58 days in the campaign to go!  People are amazing.  You are amazing. We are overwhelmed.  Getting well is a long, long journey and any relief of financial stress is invaluable. 

**24 hour UPDATE...  You are all so wonderful.... its reminds me of the final scene in "Its a Wonderful LIfe"... lets blow her mind!  Think we could get to $10 000??  We are still adding new prizes!**

** 5 Hour UPDATE.... 5 hours after we went live, we hit $4000!  Keep the love pouring in!  It is all so very very useful, wonderful and needed :-)  ....The real goal is not a number of dollars but enough TIME to get Amy well.  And that *will* takes time..... You all rock! Every little bit is so encouraging!  ***


The Impact!

Cancer is a test of physical endurance... but it is equally a test of emotional, psychological and financial stamina.  If we can help with one, it will help with the others.   Amy is determined to beat this... but she need the support and love of the people who care about her to do it.  


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

    • You can get the word out and make some noise about the campaign!
    • You can send Amy good energy and positive thoughts... maybe a personal note to offer assistance :-) 
    • And if you have services or goods to offer... we'd happily add them to the incentive list!  Just to make the fundraising a little more fun- Amy would appreciate that :-)

story:
Sixteen students. Two Weeks. One City. The journey of a lifetime...

The Code Cadets are a group of Year 7 - 12 boys at Canberra Grammar School in Australia who have a (healthy) obsession with technology.

In addition to studying IT-subjects at school (including web programming and iOS app development) the Code Cadets meet outside of normal school time to chat, network, and work on their own entrepreneurial technology-related projects (...and eat pizza...).

These boys are not typical teenagers who sit around playing games all day - they are interested in technology on the technical and code level. The achievements of our Code Cadets include winning Hackathons together with major engineering competitions.

The Code Cadets have mainstreamed something which was traditionally seen as geeky or nerdy, and made it extremely cool and the thing which everyone wants to do. The popularity of this trip is certainly a testament to this success.

To allow our group to see IT on a grand scale, outside of our home city of Canberra, we are organising a trip during January and February 2013 to the birthplace of the IT boom, San Francisco, for the Macworld | iWorld 2013 Conference.

Additionally, many high-tech companies in Silicon Valley are kindly opening their doors to our group, allowing us to visit and speak with executives and engineers.

Of course, we are also going to have time for sightseeing and taking-in everything San Francisco. For some of the boys this is the first time overseas, and for almost all the boys it's their first trip to San Francisco.

This is truly going to be an amazing and life changing experience for the group.

However, we still need to get to the other side of the world (which is not a cheap proposition by any means). So...

As you can appreciate, we are travelling during a peak time of the year (January/February 2013) so the costs of this trip are quite expensive - around $6000 per student. Much of this expense comprises our airfares, accommodation, and transport, so any contribution that you are able to offer will benefit our group tremendously.

All contributions go directly towards the boys and reducing their costs. If you are able to contribute $100 or less then this will go towards helping to reduce our major costs mentioned above (airfares, accommodation, and transport). Remember, every little bit (regardless of amount) will help!

If you are able to contribute over $100 (which would be super-awesome!) you are now directly funding an activity on our trip. If you take a look at the perks on the right-hand side you will see a mapping of your contribution to a specific activity, so you can see a direct positive cause-and-effect of your contribution. We've also got some tokens of our appreciation that we would be delighted to share in recognition of your contributions.

Our funding goal is $10,000, as we didn't want to be unrealistically optimistic. There are 16 boys on our trip in total, so this would reduce the cost by $625 per student (given that the trip costs $6000 per student this reduction is substantial). If we don't reach our funding goal that's alright, as we can certainly use any contributed funds. However, if we go over our funding goal then we will be ecstatic, as we could certainly use the additional funds :)

Our group is already so excited about the trip, with comments such as...

Your contribution will help support the future.

This is a school trip, so you can rest assured that 100% of your contribution is going towards our group and subsiding the costs of our trip. There's no middle-man taking their cut here.

So that you can see the faces of those you will be helping out, meet the Code Cadets Class of 2012 who are embarking on the big trip...

Thanks so much for reading about our trip and please visit our website at http://www.codecadets.com for more information.

story:
The Situation

Education is one of the biggest issues in our society.  Standardized test scores are extremely low.  Children are being promoted to the next grade without mastering the skills required for them to be successful in the future.  And if that isn’t bad enough, hundreds of thousands of teachers have lost their jobs over the last five years.  It is time for us to help out the public school system and the government.  It’s time we take charge as parents, aunts, cousins and friends to do whatever it takes to improve this situation.  The future seems pretty bleak… which is why we’re reaching out to you!

Our plan is to build an online school that will reinforce the basics that our kids need to succeed.  Our online environment will be informative, fun and an excellent supplement to what kids are learning in school.  This will also provide more of an opportunity for parents to get and stay involved in the education process.  We’ve also been personally impacted by the layoffs to educators over the past few years.  We would like to put some of these teachers back to work, so that they can do what they love and earn a little extra income at the same time.

 Next Steps?

  With your donations we’ll be able to.

  • Procure the hardware and bandwidth required to operate an online school.  This will be an all online school, with live video for instruction and communication between educators, parents and students
  • Work with educators to build our curriculum.  We are reaching out to current and ex K-12 teachers and administrators to work with us to develop the school policies and lessons to administer.

 In this round of funding, we are looking to raise $55000.00 USD to get the school active.  Please consider helping us in any way you can.  Please check back to this page often for updates.  You can also signup for updates by going to www.lunchreadables.com.

Other Ways You Can Help Bring This Project to Life

If you can't donate, we completely understand. We hope, at least, you can ask others to help us out with Project: LunchReadables. Share this page with your friends, like our video on YouTube, share it on Facebook and Twitter.  Spread the word to any teachers, parents, kids…. anybody!  Help us spread the word so we can get this school up and running.  Thanks for your time.

story:
Our Story

Everyday, millions of rebuildable computers are discarded or scrapped, and there are many people who are unable to afford these devices that will connect them to their families, communities, and services that they can use to improve their families lives

Not 4 Profit Inc provides programs to communities that are designed to reduce the digital divide in rural communities by repurposing computers from agencies, and providing them to school districts to promote academic excellence and citizenship in their community

Excellence in Education is a program founded in 2008, when it was decided to start a program of students helping students, and their communities by volunteering to repair, and rebuild computers that were donated to Not 4 Profit Inc

This program was inspired by our desire to assist the students and members of the community to provide refurbished computers that would enable families and students to overcome the digital divide

Excellence in Education encourages students in elementary, high school, and college to apply their energies to their scholastic endeavors, and to their community by volunteering and assisting other citizens who require a helping hand

The magic of the effects of Excellence in Education in the community has produced a positive effect for students to demonstrate the way that the next generation of youth can express and empower themselves. The cultivation of students helping students and their communities has fostered a greater sense of self-worth and confidence in the students that participate in the program

Since 2008, we have provided over 2000 refurbished computers to students who have excelled in their academic pursuit, and each student has made a difference by assisting others who needed a helping hand

Our program is being built from the ground up; and 100% of our revenue comes from people like YOU. We want this program to spread across the USA, and to repurpose refurbish the discarded computers, and to provide them to the many students who need or require them to overcome the digital divide, and we need your help!

We know that the students who can benefit the most from this kind of experience are often those without the financial means to afford it. Your donation will mean more students can participate in this life-changing experience

Many communities could benefit by starting their own campaign to reuse these valuable assets, and to return it to serve those who are most in need. In 2013, it is more important than ever for students to have access to a computer to achieve academic success in their goal toward a career; and a computer opens the door to possibilities that can be achieved through education and working toward the greater good

 

You can help us make it happen!

Your donations help reduce the inequalities between individuals, households, businesses, and geographic areas of different socioeconomic and other demographic levels, and will reduce the digital divide and ensure equal access to resources that will serve all students!  

Helping us reach our goal of $2,500.00 will allow us to: 

  • Purchase components for the repair of the 100 donated computers for refurbishment
  • Offer an additional 100 computers to students that participate in the Excellence in Education Program

If we don't meet our goal, all funds received will be donated to the student campus fund or towards buying much needed supplies

Not only will you be rewarded for contributing to this worthwhile cause; we're also throwing in some rewards from the educational production that our students are producing before the semester begins

Excellence in Education offers the opportunity for students to learn digital video in the production of an educational research project that has been licensed to produce subjects of research that will enhance the knowledge of all mankind, and demonstrate how everyone can photograph what is hiding in plain sight!

The information and evidence produced can be evaluated to perfect the knowledge that one may already possess with The Secret of the Ages

You can download the information file here: The Secret of the Ages

Download the Release from the Research: The Mysteries & Secrets of Heaven & Earth

Check out our list of Rewards to the right, which offer an opportunity to join, participate or contribute to these worthy endeavors to assist others that promote and foster a movement to help one another to a higher plane of consciousness and existence

 

The Impact

All over the country, education, schools, and nonprofits are navigating drastically diminishing budgets. Unfortunately, nonprofits are one of the first to be cut. We know the crucial role that computers provide in intellectual and personal development. After all, it was the computers in school programs that started many of us on our own paths to creativity 

That's why we're so excited to offer an alternative to students who do not have programs or other opportunities to obtain a personal computer for their use in their school activities. Even for students whose parents can afford computers, nothing can replace the valuable and often more rewarding experience of volunteering and helping others to cross the digital divide 

The Excellence in Education Project school programs will give students the chance to participate fully and actively in their education.  As well as a program that promotes students helping students, it is also provides a life-skills, and awareness program of the necessity to contribute to their communities through volunteering. Students will have the chance to do new things, explore multiple creative practices, learn and share different points of view, build self-confidence, and learn how to help others for positive and effective social change 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Want to take your investment further?  We have many other ways for you to get involved:

  • Share this campaign with your friends, families and coworkers via email, twitter and Facebook. This is VERY EFFECTIVE! 
  • Ask your favorite bar to host a happy hour benefit
  • Petition your local thrift store for computer donations
  • Approach your local businesses for computer donations
  • While you're spring cleaning, donate that old computer and give it a new home

 

No idea is too small or insignificant!
story_txt:
Our Story
Everyday, millions of rebuildable computers are discarded or scrapped, and there are many people who are unable to afford these devices that will connect them to their families, communities, and services that they can use to improve their families lives
Not 4 Profit Inc provides programs to communities that are designed to reduce the digital divide in rural communities by repurposing computers from agencies, and providing them to school districts to promote academic excellence and citizenship in their community
Excellence in Education is a program founded in 2008, when it was decided to start a program of students helping students, and their communities by volunteering to repair, and rebuild computers that were donated to Not 4 Profit Inc
This program was inspired by our desire to assist the students and members of the community to provide refurbished computers that would enable families and students to overcome the digital divide
Excellence in Education encourages students in elementary, high school, and college to apply their energies to their scholastic endeavors, and to their community by volunteering and assisting other citizens who require a helping hand
The magic of the effects of Excellence in Education in the community has produced a positive effect for students to demonstrate the way that the next generation of youth can express and empower themselves. The cultivation of students helping students and their communities has fostered a greater sense of self-worth and confidence in the students that participate in the program
Since 2008, we have provided over 2000 refurbished computers to students who have excelled in their academic pursuit, and each student has made a difference by assisting others who needed a helping hand
Our program is being built from the ground up; and 100% of our revenue comes from people like YOU. We want this program to spread across the USA, and to repurpose refurbish the discarded computers, and to provide them to the many students who need or require them to overcome the digital divide, and we need your help!
We know that the students who can benefit the most from this kind of experience are often those without the financial means to afford it. Your donation will mean more students can participate in this life-changing experience
Many communities could benefit by starting their own campaign to reuse these valuable assets, and to return it to serve those who are most in need. In 2013, it is more important than ever for students to have access to a computer to achieve academic success in their goal toward a career; and a computer opens the door to possibilities that can be achieved through education and working toward the greater good
 
You can help us make it happen!
Your donations help reduce the inequalities between individuals, households, businesses, and geographic areas of different socioeconomic and other demographic levels, and will reduce the digital divide and ensure equal access to resources that will serve all students!  
Helping us reach our goal of $2,500.00 will allow us to: 

Purchase components for the repair of the 100 donated computers for refurbishment
Offer an additional 100 computers to students that participate in the Excellence in Education Program
If we don't meet our goal, all funds received will be donated to the student campus fund or towards buying much needed supplies
Not only will you be rewarded for contributing to this worthwhile cause; we're also throwing in some rewards from the educational production that our students are producing before the semester begins
Excellence in Education offers the opportunity for students to learn digital video in the production of an educational research project that has been licensed to produce subjects of research that will enhance the knowledge of all mankind, and demonstrate how everyone can photograph what is hiding in plain sight!
The information and evidence produced can be evaluated to perfect the knowledge that one may already possess with The Secret of the Ages
You can download the information file here: The Secret of the Ages
Download the Release from the Research: The Mysteries & Secrets of Heaven & Earth
Check out our list of Rewards to the right, which offer an opportunity to join, participate or contribute to these worthy endeavors to assist others that promote and foster a movement to help one another to a higher plane of consciousness and existence
 
The Impact
All over the country, education, schools, and nonprofits are navigating drastically diminishing budgets. Unfortunately, nonprofits are one of the first to be cut. We know the crucial role that computers provide in intellectual and personal development. After all, it was the computers in school programs that started many of us on our own paths to creativity 
That's why we're so excited to offer an alternative to students who do not have programs or other opportunities to obtain a personal computer for their use in their school activities. Even for students whose parents can afford computers, nothing can replace the valuable and often more rewarding experience of volunteering and helping others to cross the digital divide 
The Excellence in Education Project school programs will give students the chance to participate fully and actively in their education.  As well as a program that promotes students helping students, it is also provides a life-skills, and awareness program of the necessity to contribute to their communities through volunteering. Students will have the chance to do new things, explore multiple creative practices, learn and share different points of view, build self-confidence, and learn how to help others for positive and effective social change 
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Want to take your investment further?  We have many other ways for you to get involved:

Share this campaign with your friends, families and coworkers via email, twitter and Facebook. This is VERY EFFECTIVE! 
Ask your favorite bar to host a happy hour benefit
Petition your local thrift store for computer donations
Approach your local businesses for computer donations
While you're spring cleaning, donate that old computer and give it a new home
 
No idea is too small or insignificant!

story:
Our Story:

We are a group of French Students from Corner Brook, Newfoundland attending Grenfell Campus Memorial University.  Over the past three years we have been working extremely hard to complete our minors in French, and this year as a reward for all of our dedication we decided that it would be nice to travel to France to experience the French culture that we talk about everyday in class.  Also, we wanted to put our language skills to work and truly immerse ourselves in the French language.  

Every week our group works diligently to raise money for our trip. We have recycling drives, bottle blitzes, bake sales, and we are constantly planning for more fundraisers.  The point is, that as university students we simply do not have to money to afford going on such an expensive trip when we can barely pay for our own groceries!  In order for us to be able to go, we'll need at least $1000 each to subsidize the trip costs...

This is why we need your help!!! Any donation, big or small means the world to us!  If you cannot make a donation, we completely understand, but if you have any fundraising ideas please feel free to email us (contact info below) or just let your friends and family know about our cause! 

We truly thank you for taking the time to read about our cause. If you have any questions about our trip please just send us a quick email and we'll be happy to answer!

 

Contact: 

grenfelltofrance@groups.facebook.com

or

rpieroway@grenfell.mun.ca

story:
What is QED?

QED is a two-day science and skepticism convention taking place at the Mercure Piccadilly Hotel in Manchester, England, on the 13th-14th April 2013.

http://qedcon.org/

Who am I?

I'm Peter Bowditch and I run the RatbagsDotCom web site. You can find me on Twitter at @RatbagsDotCom. I live in Wentworth Falls in the beautiful Blue Mountains west of Sydney down here in Australia, a long way from Manchester.

Why am I going?

It's to meet and interact with people who don't get to the conferences I normally attend in Australia and the USA.

What will I do afterwards?

I will be interviewing people at the event and also writing articles about the presentations. These articles and interviews will be published on various web sites and podcasts (and even some old-fashioned print magazines and papers).

The budget

I'm after money for airfare, accommodation and incidental expenses (plus Indiegogo fee) to get me to and from QED in April 2013. I've set the target based on what the airlines and hotels are quoting now (September 2012) for bookings in April, plus an allowance for the fact that these will inevitably rise as the time gets closer.

If I raise too much?

If the campaign raises more than I actually have to spend on the trip then 20% of the excess will be donated to the Children's Hospital at Westmead and the rest will go towards getting me to Las Vegas for TAM in July 2013.

If I don't raise enough?

I've set the end of the campaign at December 31 to allow time to make sure that my life is in place well in time for an overseas trip in April. If by that date I haven't raised enough then the money will be distributed as if it was more than I needed - 20% to the Children's Hospital and the rest towards getting to TAM.

What more can I say?

Manchester, England, England, across the Atlantic sea. And I'm a genius, genius - I don't believe in God but I believe that God believes in Pete, that's me.

(And now you can guess how old I am, seeing that I was able to recall the words of that song without looking it up on Google.)

story: The fall of 2010 my sixteen-year-old son came to me and told me he was going on a mission trip to Mexico through an organization called Adventures in Missions. I don't believe he gave me an option. As a mother I wanted to protect him and part of me had reservations about the trip. The part of me that knew he had been called by God to go on this trip took over. I knew the risks and death was one of them. My son new as well, but was willing to sacrafice everything for God. We both also knew that God is bigger than any situation and He would be his protector; and He was. The trip was changed due to dangerous drug cartel activity a few weeks before the departure date and was moved to south Texas. My son came home a different person. He continued in missions to Nicaragua that same summer and this summer of 2012 he spent two months in Honduras. I have seen first hand how the Lord has used my son to preach, teach, and love on so many of the unloved; the untouchables. I have heard the stories of God multiplying food when it appeared there wouldn't be enough for those lined up in the dumpster city of Honduras for spaghetti in a styrofoam cup. I have heard of the hopeless coming to Christ after hearing His promises. I have felt a tugging on my heart for sometime to start moving more for the Lord. I will never be able to "do enough" and I know that it why Jesus died on the cross. I know He took it all for me and you and the people all over the world. They need to know. I love God with all my heart, mind, soul and strength and want nothing more than to reach those who haven't heard of His love, His great sacrafice, and His wonderful promise to those who will call upon His name as their savior. I can't do this alone. I need your help. This mission trip will cost $4000 and that includes my trip fee to Adventures in Missions(adventuresinmissions.org) my plane ticket to Kenya, and my travel vaccines. I am covering other incidentals myself. I also need prayer from now until a few weeks after I return. The preparation physically, mentally and spiritually is nothing I take lightly and can use prayer. The time I am in the mission field I ask that you pray for those hearts that will be hearing the gospel and feeling the love of Jesus. I also ask for prayer upon my return to the states. I watched my son's heart ache upon his return, and I know it will be a difficult time. Please also pray for safety during travel. I ask that you lift up Sherry McMorris as well. She and I are going together on this trip and will need prayer as well. Thank you so much for your financial support and your prayful support. May God bless you.

story:
DAC Foundation

My names Ellie and I will be taking a gap year before University to Ghana, Africa with the Dream Africa Care Foundation.The Dream Africa Care Foundation works to provide an improvemnet in education, community care and health care in Ghana, Africa. I will be volunteering in schools to teach English and help out in orphanges to provide essential support to children and the local community.

How the Money Helps

The money raised will go towards helping the community and supporting my time out there. The more money raised, the better, as more materials will be brought and the longer I can spend out there to help make a significant difference. By sponsoring this campaign your money will be used directly to change lives for the better.

Donate and Share!

I would appreciate any contribution made, and if you can share my campaign that would be amazing! Thank you!

story:
The official investigation being run by governments and agencies has failed to find the plane, due to either incompetence or obfuscation.

We must work together to ensure the truth is found.

   On behalf of the 3.1 billion people who fly every year we must find the truth and bring those accountable to justice. We must also prevent this from ever happening again."

   ... Sarah Bajc, Partner of Philip Wood, Seat 11C on MH370



 



MH370 disappeared from radar in the early morning of March 8, 2014. It was on a routine flight from Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia to Beijing, China when it vanished over the South China Sea.

In the 100+ days since the last contact was made with MH370 there have been claims of multiple debris sightings, satellite images, pings from the air and the ocean, and hundreds of conspiracy theories which have all amounted to nothing.

Still, the plane did disappear from radar, potentially flew for an additional  7 hours undetected and unchallenged only to vanish completely without a trace. Whilst it is inconceivable this could happen to a modern jumbo jet that is what the Malaysian Government would have us believe.

This mystery has too many unknowns, false leads, unconfirmed facts and missing details. Yet, someone somewhere knows what happened to flight MH370. We hope to encourage them to come forward.



The first aspect of the campaign will be to fully fund a reward that is sizable enough to change someone’s life. Our target remains $5 million and we realize this may take a little longer than anticipated and require funds generated outside of the Indiegogo campaign.

To ensure we meet this goal we are actively negotiating with key donors willing to support the reward-only aspect of our project with sizeable pledges held in an escrow to meet the funding target. These funds would be provided only in the result of a whistle blower coming forward and the reward becoming payable.

The second aspect of the campaign will be to engage a professional, licensed private investigation company to follow up on all leads we had prior to the commencement of this campaign and rule out those which are not worth pursuing.

The third aspect will to continue to fund the investigation of leads received through the reward program. This would be a requirement for the larger pledges to be secured. The more we raise, the more investigation we can do.



We believe there is a person or persons who know the truth about what happened, and know where the plane is.  We want to encourage the truth to come out by offering a substantial reward.


Every effort to locate the plane and all on board over the past 100+ days has failed. Continuing along the same path of searching under the Southern Indian Ocean is unlikely to change the outcome. Many people believe that entire exercise is a ruse to cover up what really happened.

Something must change if we are to locate the plane and all on board. Someone somewhere knows the truth we need that person/persons to come forward and provide that information to us.

Once we have these leads our efforts will include more traditional investigative work to ensure the information provide is factual and will lead to the recovery of the plane and all on board. This will include leveraging on-ground resources in areas of interest to explore leads.




The disappearance of MH370 has highlighted many flaws in the aviation industry and the procedures used to screen passengers, cargo and monitor aircraft in flight.

This unprecedented event has placed a dark cloud over the safety of over EIGHT MILLION airline passengers every day. Until MH370 is recovered and the cause of the disappearance is known the skies will not be safe. The next time it maybe you or I on board a flight that goes missing.



The investigation, as the Malaysian Government has run it, has failed to date despite significant resource contribution by many hard working searchers, and the taxpayers of many countries. To those who contributed to those efforts , we give our whole hearted thanks.

OUR effort will not be to rehash the failures with the current investigation. Rather, we will put a fresh set of eyes on the mystery. We will use proven investigative techniques, and will do our best to offer an incentive for someone to bring forward leads that have not been considered before.

The Australian Government has said they will invest another $90 million searching the floor of the Southern Indian Ocean over the next 12 months. We think this may be a total waste of taxpayer funds and end with the same result. Unless the truth comes out about where the plane really is, every search is at best a “guestimate” scenario.





The Reward MH370 initiative is lead by a team of six people: four who are family members of passengers on the ill-fated flight, and two who are experienced with fundraising and private investigation.

All decisions made regarding management of the campaign, selection of and coordination with private investigation resources, lead advancement and reward payment must be approved by a majority vote taken by the Governance Committee.


Ghislain Wattrelos

No one feels the devastation of the loss of MH370 more than Ghislain Wattrelos, a French business executive. His wife Laurence and two of his teenage children, Hadrian and Amber, were returning from a holiday in Malaysia.

“How could this happen? In this age of constant connection and pervasive surveillance, a giant plane has been allowed to just disappear. That cannot be an accident.” Says Wattrelos. “My family deserves to be found.”



Sarah Bajc

Partner of Philip Wood, who was returning to Beijing to help her pack up their apartment for a move to Kuala Lumpur, has worked tirelessly to find the truth since the flight disappeared.

She believes “Without a fresh approach, the truth and the plane will never be found.” According to Bajc, a high school economics teacher, “Governments and agencies have given it their best shot but have failed to turn up a single shred of evidence, either because of a faulty approach or due to intentional misdirection.” 




K.S. Narendran

“Lives are important. So is truth. Personal loss is hard to bear, but to live in fear is intolerable.

If we can know what happened and do so collectively by all means in our hands, we help ourselves and we serve others,” says K.S. Narendran, an Indian Management Consultant whose wife Chandrika Sharma is also on MH370.

“I want to find my wife, and I want to know the truth. Without the truth, families cannot move on with their lives. We need closure. The world needs closure.”


Pralhad Shirseth

“Since the disappearance of MH370 a dark cloud has hung over the safety of air travel and there has been growing unease over the inability of governments and their agencies to work together to ensure we are all safe when we fly.” says Pralhad Shirseth, whose wife, Kranti, was on her way to visit him in North Korea, where he was Managing an Irish-based NGO.

According to Pralhad, “Until MH370 is found and the reason for its disappearance is known we will be bombarded with conspiracy theories, false leads, books and movies which will provide nothing but conjecture. We need to find the truth and ensure this never happens again.”




Maarten Van Sluys

A Brazilian businessman, who lost his sister on Air France 447 in 2009, and was instrumental in the search and recovery of AF447, considers the mystery of MH370 more baffling, more complex and more daunting than what investigators experienced when AF447 crashed.

He said, “This recovery is going to take all the efforts of a great deal of people and I applaud the initiative of this project and the potential it will bring to the solving of this mystery.”


Ethan Hunt

“This mystery is unprecedented in the history of aviation, and we need to work as a collective community with one goal of finding the truth, the plane and the passengers,” said Ethan Hunt.

Hunt is the CEO of Rapide 3D, a former military airmen, an experienced private investigator, and a successful Indiegogo fundraiser. Hunt said. “We are convinced that somewhere, someone knows something, and we hope this reward will entice him or her to come forward.”

That cannot be an accident.” Says Wattrelos. “My family deserves to be found.”Sarah Bajc  Partner of Philip Wood, who was returning to Beijing to help her pack up their apartment for a move to Kuala Lumpur, has worked tirelessly to find the truth since the flight disappeared.   She believes “Without a fresh approach, the truth and the plane will never be found.” According to Bajc, a high school economics teacher, “Governments and agencies have given it their best shot but have failed to turn up a single shred of evidence, either because of a faulty approach or due to intentional misdirection.” K.S. Narendran  “Lives are important. So is truth.  Personal loss is hard to bear, but to live in fear is intolerable.    If we can know what happened and do so collectively by all means in our hands, we help ourselves and we serve others,” says K.S. Narendran, an Indian Management Consultant whose wife Chandrika Sharma is also on MH370.    “I want to find my wife, and I want to know the truth.  Without the truth, families cannot move on with their lives. We need closure. The world needs closure.”Pralhad Shirseth  “Since the disappearance of MH370 a dark cloud has hung over the safety of air travel and there has been growing unease over the inability of governments and their agencies to work together to ensure we are all safe when we fly.” says Pralhad Shirseth, whose wife, Kranti, was on her way to visit him in North Korea, where he was Managing an Irish-based NGO.   According to Pralhad, “Until MH370 is found and the reason for its disappearance is known we will be bombarded with conspiracy theories, false leads, books and movies which will provide nothing but conjecture. We need to find the truth and ensure this never happens again.”Maarten Van Sluys   A Brazilian businessman, who lost his sister on Air France 447 in 2009, and was instrumental in the search and recovery of AF447, considers the mystery of MH370 more baffling, more complex and more daunting than what investigators experienced when AF447 crashed.   He said, “This recovery is going to take all the efforts of a great deal of people and I applaud the initiative of this project and the potential it will bring to the solving of this mystery.”Ethan Hunt  “This mystery is unprecedented in the history of aviation, and we need to work as a collective community with one goal of finding the truth, the plane and the passengers,” said Ethan Hunt.   Hunt is the CEO of Rapide 3D, a former military airmen, an experienced private investigator, and a successful Indiegogo fundraiser. Hunt said. “We are convinced that somewhere, someone knows something, and we hope this reward will entice him or her to come forward.”

story:
About the Project

Hagar Vietnam would like to establish a new computer lab to empower disadvantaged women who have survived human trafficking, sexual exploitation and domestic violence.  In the past, these disadvantaged women have had limited opportunities to pursue their goals and dreams. This project is designed to assist Hagar's clients by enhancing their educational skills and providing them with necessary skills to increase their employment prospects. With your help, we would like to set up a computer lab consisting of 5 individual computer stations within the Transitional Center (Residential Care Facility).  The project will provide residential clients with 24/7 access to the computer lab, enabling them to improve their English skills and allow them to pursue vocational training for alternative careers paths.  A portion of the money raised will also be used for the purchase of new educational software. This project will be implemented by the Hagar staff and IT trained volunteers through a partnership with other NGOs in Vietnam. 

About Hagar Vietnam

Established in 2009, Hagar Vietnam is committed to the psychosocial recovery and economic empowerment of women who are survivors of human trafficking, sexual exploitation and domestic violence. Our organization continues to develop innovative ways to assist these women. Since 2009, over 150 women have gained autonomy and security, becoming independent contributing members of society.

Hagar Vietnam provides long-term, individualized services for women, including residential and transitional care, medical support, legal aid, counseling, education, family services and economic empowerment. Although each woman’s journey is different, each is assisted with walking through the following spheres of change: protection, personal wellbeing, societal change, economic empowerment, and social capital.

About Hagar International

Hagar's purpose is singular; we restore broken lives.  We welcome the toughest of human conditions.  We stay focused on the individual. And we do whatever it takes for as long as it takes to restore a broken life.

Hagar currently has programs in Afghanistan, Cambodia, and Vietnam.  We also have supporting offices in Australia, Hong Kong, New Zealand, Singapore,  United Kingdom, and the United States of America.

Hagar will expand to Myanmar in 2014.


What we need

1.  $2500.00 USD: 5 computers

2.  $250.00 USD: 5 work-stations

3.  $370.00 USD: Internet setup, maintenance, and wifi for one (1) year

4.  $100.00 USD: Start-up costs

5.  $250.00 USD:  educational software

Total: $3470.00 USD

Other Ways You Can Help

Please go to the link: www.hagarinternational.org to find out more opportunities to support us.

story:
Short Summary

The world is full of different schools designed to fulfill the unique needs of the students they serve. Students and their families rely on teachers to deliver that service. Some teachers go to extreme measures to fulfill their commitment. In these schools, and many others around the globe, caring, knowledgeable teachers work hard to serve their students. They utilize whatever tools are available to create and deliver lessons that make a difference in their students’ lives.

Teachers2Teachers—International was created to provide teachers with professional training for the mathematics and science classroom. We send teams of experienced coaches to schools in all parts of the world to partner with the local teachers. After an initial introductory visit has been completed, a typical coaching trip will last for one or two weeks. The expertise and knowledge of the local staff is included in designing the professional development program.

What We Need & What You Get

Your contribution will help send one team of teachers to Santa Avelina, Guatemala and one team of teachers to La Esperanza, Honduras.  Teachers will spend about 10 days in country building a close relationship with a local teacher.  They will build on that relationship when they return home by regularly meeting virtually.

The Impact

We will be sending teams of teachers from the United States to partner with local teachers, building meaningful long-term relationships that last throughout the year.  Both teachers from the US and the local teachers will grow professionally and personally from this experience.

The William M. Botnan School serves children from preschool to fifth grade in Santa Avelina; a small rural Mayan community nestled in the highlands of Guatemala. Its primary focus is on providing quality education to students with a particular emphasis on reestablishing first language learning in the Mayan language (Ixil). All of the Santa Avelina teachers speak their native language, Ixil, and Spanish. They each hold a high school diploma and have participated in ongoing professional development to bolster their understanding and application of effective instruction. Principal Rosa Cordova Perez holds a bachelors degree and actively supports the professional learning efforts, and she works to ensure implementation is maintained throughout the year. Teachers2Teachers – International sent its first team to the William M. Botnan School in June 2013 and will return in June of 2014 and years to come.

Another Trip this summer will be to El Maestro en Casa, a middle and high school in central Honduras serving some of the poorest students in the region. Because they cannot afford to attend school five or six days a week, students in this school travel up to two hours to and from school to attend one day of classes, completing distance-learning coursework from workbooks the remainder of the week. The school is served by four very dedicated teachers who are each responsible for an entire grade level of up to 300 students, teaching those students every subject required for graduation. Two days a week, rain or shine, the teachers travel on motorcycles into remote mountain communities to provide lessons to students who cannot attend classes at the school’s campus in La Esperanza. Teachers2Teachers – International sent its first team to El Maestro en Casa in July, 2013 and will be returning in July of 2014.

Other Ways You Can Help

Everyone can help!  Tell teachers you know about our organization and help us make connections to other schools in the world.  


You can also visit our resource website, GlobalMathStories.org, and contribute a story or add a resource to an existing story.

story:
Meet Taras Kornelyuk

Taras arrived from Kharkov, Ukraine in November 2012 to attend Saint Joseph Preparatory High School in Brighton, MA. A 2014 Graduate, he was accepted at Regis College in Westin, MA [www.regiscollege.edu] and has been awarded academic scholarships to cover 80% of the tuition. His family remains in Eastern Ukraine and their financial challenges, due to the instability there, has made financing this great college opportunity not within reach.

What We Need

To fill the tuition gap—after his parent's contribution and fundraising done on his behalf by The Eugene Kinasewich Fund [www.genesfund.org]—he needs about $2,700 for each of the next four years. Taras will continue living in Randolph, cost free, with Lynn McNamee and Stephanie Spunt to responsibly lessen the financial burden of fulfilling his American College dream. 

His Story

Taras first came to America with his ice hockey team, Druhzba78–known for their coach's unique skating technique/training, when he was only 12 years old. The team came each summer and traveled up and down the East Coast, demonstrating their technique in ice hockey clinics. The kids chosen for this elite hockey team did not come from the local Ukrainian rinks, but were discovered on soccer fields and then taught to skate. Those who succeeded were not only fine athletes but, more importantly, were dedicated to hard work, discipline and good morals. Taras is the poster child of these characteristics.

When Taras came to Boston his English skills did need much work and the school was not offering ESL courses that first year. Through diligence, dinner discussions (no Russian speaking allowed) and many late nights hitting the books, he has achieved great success academically. In his 2 years at Saint Joseph Prep he has captained the hockey and track teams, learned to row by joining the crew team and was MVP of the soccer team. He has been a beloved student at Saint Joseph Prep and has been the recipient of many athletic and academic awards, both at school and state wide.

Because of the situation in his home country over the last 6+ months, it has become even more important for him to continue his path to higher education in America. By supporting a student like Taras fulfill his dream, we are laying the groundwork for strengthening the future of Ukraine with knowledge, kindness and hope.

Ways You Can Help

Through this crowd funding site you have the opportunity to offer Taras your gift. Every bit will help! Due to the nature of this site your gift is not tax deductible.

As an alternative with tax benefit, you may help by donating to The Eugene Kinasewich Fund [www.genesfund.org/aboutus/howtocontribute.cfm] in Taras' name. 

If you choose to help via Gene's Fund, please be sure to put Taras Kornelyuk on the memo line of your check, and consider sending an email to me [lynn.mcnamee22@gmail.com] so we can track the contributions to Taras.

Even if you are unable to assist Taras, please consider visiting the Gene's Fund website and learn about this man of Ukrainian heritage. He initiated the program originally bringing kids like Taras to the U.S. to brighten their future opportunities. He was truly amazing.

Thank You, Thank You, Thank You.

Those who have met Taras agree they want to see his hard work and diligence rewarded with this opportunity to further his studies in America. It will, however, take the proverbial village to help him realize his dream and your participation is greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

Lynn McNamee, Stephanie Spunt and Taras Kornelyuk

story:
"Training Wheels for Kids"

Although most kids will strenuously disagree, children aren't born knowing how to use the Internet safely and responsibly. Like any other technology -- knives, power tools, guns, cars -- kids need to be taught what's ok and what's not when they're using electronic devices.

MessageSafe is designed to help parents do just that. Building on co-founder Frederick Lane's book, Cybertraps for the Young, the MessageSafe app and text archiving Web site enable parents to monitor their young device users and educate them about the electronic "rules of the road."

We believe that education is the key to preventing dangerous and destructive activities like cyberbullying and sexting. As Fred has said in lectures to parents around the country, the earlier that online safety education begins, the more effective it will be.

What We Need & What You Get

The MessageSafe apps and Web site are in the final stages of development. We are asking for your help to raise $17,500 to put the final polishing touches on this valuable software and to provide funds for our initial publicity campaign.

In return for your generous support, we offer free year-long subscriptions, unlimited subscriptions, signed copies of Cybertraps for the Young, online Q&A sessions with Fred, and in-person information sessions for your school or parent's group wherever you are based. Check the perks on the right for the details.

We're excited to be releasing our apps and Web site archive, but this is not just a product pitch. The MessageSafe team is committed to assisting parents in understanding the rapidly-changing technologies and online resources available to kids, and to assisting parents in raising safe and responsible children.

The MessageSafe Team

The Founders

Frederick Lane is a leading analyst on the impact of technology on society. Lane came up with the idea for Cybertraps as a result of his work as a computer forensics expert, his research for Cybertraps for the Young, and his decade of service on the Burlington (VT) School Board. As the father to two boys and step-father to two more, Lane has had first-hand experience with the challenges of digital parenting.

Alan Lubell is an entrepreneur with extensive experience taking ideas from inception to operation. He helped turn the NYC Marathon into a global event by bringing it to television, and developed a swing-analysis product with renowned golfer Greg Norman. The father of four and grandfather of three, Lubell understands the risks and challenges facing today’s parents.

Technical Advisors

Jay Bhattacharya is an experienced entrepreneur in the mobile space. A veteran of Citigroup’s financial ventures group, Bhattacharya is currently directing the growth and development of two mobile start-ups, Zipmark and Capture.

Glenn Lipson, Ph.D., A.B.P.P. is Program Director at Alliant International University. A practicing Licensed Psychologist, he has achieved the Diplomat status in Forensic Psychology from the American Board of Professional Psychology. He has spent more than two decades assisting law enforcement and the courts, testifying about online harassment, sex crimes, and all manner of threats. At the present time he is spearheading a national campaign to assist schools in protecting students from school employee and peer sexual misconduct.  Drawing on his many years of experience, he knows the profound need to educate about how to best handle and/or monitor  text messages and emails so as to prevent harm.

Donna Rice Hughes is President and CEO of Enough Is Enough, a leading Internet child safety organization. Hughes is Executive Producer, Host, and Instructor of EIE's Internet Safety 101 DVD series (winner of 3 Telly Awards), and the creator/author EIE's Internet Safety 101 Multimedia Program (DVD series/250 page Workbook & Resource Guide and Rules 'N Tools booklet) in partnership with U.S. Department of Justice.

Other Ways You Can Help

Word of mouth is huge. If you support our goal of helping parents to raise safe and responsible kids, then please forward this to your family, your friends, your social networks, and anyone else you think might be interested.

To paraphrase the old saying, if you give a child a cellphone, she'll be texting within a day. But if you teach a child to text safely, she'll remember it for a lifetime.

Help us spread the word, and help us raise a generation of safe and responsible texters.

story:
Why This Matters

This Indiegogo campaign is focused on raising money for Divine Yoga School, a school that provides free education to 35 children ages 3-12 while teaching them how to Live the Essence of Yoga. Right now we have one main building that serves ashram visitors and the 35 kids who eagerly come to learn six days a week. We are located in a small town in Nepal where there are not many options for children’s education. We are the only school that offers Yoga, Sanskrit and Music integrated into the daily curriculum that includes Math, Science, English, Computer, etc. Our student’s parents tell us what a remarkable difference they see in their children after coming to our school after just one or two years. Your contributions will help ensure that the school can be sustained and expanded so that more kids can receive the benefits of yoga and a great education. We thought the best way to thank you is by also giving you the gift of yoga so our perks include an autographed book written by the Founder, Yogi Prakash, a just released Yoga DVD and even a chance to come learn yoga in Nepal.

Successes

Divine Yoga School was established in 2010 and has been financially sustained by monies earned from residential yoga classes offered at Shanti Yoga Ashram, donations and private loans; we do not receive government funding. For three years we have been able to give full scholarships to 95% of the children and are currently providing clothing, food and permanent housing to four children. We have had a 100% pass rate each year and the oldest students (ages 11-12) are able to lead yoga classes. The school has participated in yoga demonstrations, music and dance performances. Perhaps our biggest success is that each day the kids arrive full of enthusiasm and leave happy. We want to expand the school and accept all children regardless of their ability to pay, but we need your help. We want to increase our capacity from 35 to 100 students and offer 10 residential spaces for children in rural and under served areas of Nepal so we humbly urge you to become a part of this project and let’s give more children the chance to have a positive and peaceful education.

Where Your Contributions Go

Fundraising Goals

We have big plans but have set our campaign goal at $33,000 to ensure we meet our goal and receive the highest percentage of funding based on Indiegogo’s campaign rules. $33,000 allows us to implement Phase I which gives 100 kids a year’s worth of education, covers all the living expenses for 10 children residing at the ashram and includes the fees charged for running this campaign. Ideally, we will move right into Phase II, constructing a new building solely dedicated to the kids schools with dormitories for 10 children. The land, building construction and furnishings will be $70,000 bringing our stretch goal to a total of $100,000.  If we get to $100,000 we can start construction on the new school building in 2014! This is huge money in Nepal but if just 971 supporters contribute $35, we will make our initial goal or if 1,000 people contribute $100 we can hit our stretch goal and break ground in 2014!! 


Sustainability

Shanti Yoga Ashram was established in 2001 and more than 2,000 students have benefited from yoga classes offered by the ashram. In 2010, Shanti Yoga Ashram founded Divine Yoga School to help preserve the knowledge of yoga by passing it on to the next generation. For the past three years, monies earned from Shanti Yoga Ashram have been used to create and support Divine Yoga School. Right now, we are fundraising for the initial setup costs of a larger children’s school. Annual costs after the fundraising year will be covered by revenues earned from Shanti Yoga Ashram and Kathmandu Yoga College, the third organization in the Lotus Project. Our goal is to open Kathmandu Yoga College in 2015 and offer a one-year yoga diploma program. In 2014, we will also begin offering a two-month intensive yoga course at Shanti Yoga Ashram, offering a preview of the one year College Program
 


Benefits of Yoga for Children

Yoga is widely accepted as having physical benefits such as increasing flexibility, strength, balance, improves posture, and strengthens the immune system. Even more important are the mental and emotional benefits that yoga has on children who practice yoga regularly, such as:

*  Increased concentration and focus

*  Improved academic performance and classroom behaviors

*  Decreased aggression and a sense of helplessness

*  Improved discernment and decision making skills

*  Increased emotional balance and calmness

*  Increased self-esteem and self-confidence

*  Increased self-acceptance and compassion for others

*  Increased creativity

“Pranayama, the practice of breath awareness prominent in yoga, encourages parasympathetic drive, allowing the body to slow down and bring the mind and body back into balance. Transferring this skill of breath is key to handling stressful situations—for instance, before taking a big test—and emphasizes a creative outlet to balance overly structured and stressful atmospheres of classrooms. Yoga can also be used as a tool to help foster students’ motivation, cultivate an internal locus of control, and facilitate deeper and more restful sleep.” -Kristin Henningsen, MS of Kaplan University, School of Health Sciences.


Other Ways you Can Help

Although money is required to sustain, develop and grow Lotus Project, there are many ways you can support this work.

#1 Help this go viral, share it on Facebook, Twitter, Email your friends. Take a moment and make it personal, tell them what inspired you and write a message to the top 5 people you think will support Lotus Project.

#2 Do you have a blog, a website, a strong following or media connections? We are experts at yoga and teaching, not marketing so we need all the help we can get from people who are to let everyone know about Lotus Project. 

#3 Yoga Teachers, you have a tremendous ability to help by reaching out to your students. Chances are they have also experienced the positive effects of yoga and would love to support children in Nepal learning yoga. Talk about this campaign in class, and share it in your newsletter. While we are visiting the US you can even organize an event in your center and Yogi Prakash can teach class or offer yoga philosophy discourse. 

#4 Throw a party. That’s right, we want people to host parties all over the world. Invite your friends and family, grab some veggies and hummus and watch our video together. You can also check out other videos on our Youtube Channel (Shanti Yoga Ashram). Then take some pics and email them to us and we will add them to our Campaign Updates and Facebook page. Whoever has the largest party or event will win one autographed Classical Tantra Yoga book written by the Founder Yogi Prakash. To qualify we must be able to count people in the photo and photo (or video) shows you watching this video.

#5 Already hosting an event? If you are hosting an event between Jan 12-Feb 24 you can share a few words of support for Lotus Project. If you are able to show our video, then take a photo and we will post it on our Campaign Updates and Facebook page. You will also be eligible in the autographed book contest mentioned in #4.
story_txt:
Why This Matters
This Indiegogo campaign is focused on raising
money for Divine
Yoga School, a school that provides free education to 35 children
ages 3-12 while teaching them how to Live the Essence of Yoga. Right now we have one main building that serves ashram visitors and the
35 kids who eagerly come to learn six days a week. We are located in a small
town in Nepal where there are not many options for children’s education. We are
the only school that offers Yoga, Sanskrit and Music integrated into the daily
curriculum that includes Math, Science, English, Computer, etc. Our student’s parents
tell us what a remarkable difference they see in their children after coming to
our school after just one or two years. Your contributions will help ensure
that the school can be sustained and expanded so that more kids can receive the
benefits of yoga and a great education. We thought the best way to thank you is
by also giving you the gift of yoga so our perks include an autographed book
written by the Founder, Yogi Prakash, a just released Yoga DVD and even a
chance to come learn yoga in Nepal.Successes 
Divine Yoga School was established in 2010 and has been financially sustained
by monies earned from residential yoga classes offered at Shanti Yoga Ashram,
donations and private loans; we do not receive government funding. For three
years we have been able to give full scholarships to 95% of the children and are
currently providing clothing, food and permanent housing to four children. We
have had a 100% pass rate each year and the oldest students (ages 11-12) are
able to lead yoga classes. The school has participated in yoga demonstrations,
music and dance performances. Perhaps our biggest success is that each day the kids arrive full of enthusiasm and leave happy. We want to expand the school and
accept all children regardless of their ability to pay, but we need your help. We
want to increase our capacity from 35 to 100 students and offer 10 residential
spaces for children in rural and under served areas of Nepal so we humbly urge
you to become a part of this project and let’s give more children the chance to
have a positive and peaceful education.
Where Your Contributions GoFundraising Goals
We have
big plans but have set our campaign goal at $33,000 to ensure we meet our goal
and receive the highest percentage of funding based on Indiegogo’s campaign
rules. $33,000 allows us to implement Phase
I which gives 100 kids a year’s worth of education, covers all the living
expenses for 10 children residing at the ashram and includes the fees charged
for running this campaign. Ideally, we will move right into Phase II, constructing a new building
solely dedicated to the kids schools with dormitories for 10 children. The land,
building construction and furnishings will be $70,000 bringing our stretch goal
to a total of $100,000.  If we get to
$100,000 we can start construction on the new school building in 2014! This is
huge money in Nepal but if just 971
supporters contribute $35, we will make our initial goal or if 1,000 people
contribute $100 we can hit our stretch goal and break ground in 2014!! Sustainability Shanti
Yoga Ashram was established in 2001 and more than 2,000 students have benefited
from yoga classes offered by the ashram. In 2010, Shanti Yoga Ashram founded
Divine Yoga School to help preserve the knowledge of yoga by passing it on to
the next generation. For the past three
years, monies earned from Shanti Yoga Ashram have been used to create and support Divine Yoga
School. Right now, we are fundraising for the initial setup costs of a larger
children’s school. Annual costs after the fundraising year will be covered by
revenues earned from Shanti Yoga Ashram and Kathmandu Yoga College, the third
organization in the Lotus Project. Our goal is to open Kathmandu Yoga College
in 2015 and offer a one-year yoga diploma program. In 2014, we will also begin
offering a two-month intensive yoga course at Shanti Yoga Ashram, offering a
preview of the one year College Program 
Benefits of Yoga for Children
Yoga is widely accepted as having physical
benefits such as increasing flexibility, strength, balance, improves posture, and
strengthens the immune system. Even more important are the mental and emotional
benefits that yoga has on children who practice yoga regularly, such as:
*  Increased concentration and focus
*  Improved academic performance and classroom
behaviors*  Decreased aggression and a sense of helplessness*  Improved discernment and decision making skills
*  Increased emotional balance and calmness
*  Increased self-esteem and self-confidence
*  Increased self-acceptance and compassion for others
*  Increased creativity
“Pranayama,
the practice of breath awareness prominent in yoga, encourages parasympathetic
drive, allowing the body to slow down and bring the mind and
body back into balance. Transferring this skill of breath is key to
handling stressful situations—for instance, before taking a big test—and
emphasizes a creative outlet to balance overly structured and stressful
atmospheres of classrooms. Yoga can also be used as a tool to help foster
students’ motivation, cultivate an internal locus of control, and facilitate
deeper and more restful sleep.”
-Kristin Henningsen, MS of Kaplan University,
School of Health Sciences. Other Ways you Can HelpAlthough
money is required to sustain, develop and grow Lotus Project, there are many
ways you can support this work.
#1 Help
this go viral, share it on Facebook, Twitter, Email your friends. Take a moment
and make it personal, tell them what inspired you and write a message to the
top 5 people you think will support Lotus Project.
#2 Do you
have a blog, a website, a strong following or media connections? We are experts
at yoga and teaching, not marketing so we need all the help we can get from
people who are to let everyone know about Lotus Project. 
#3 Yoga
Teachers, you have a tremendous ability to help by reaching out to your students. Chances
are they have also experienced the positive effects of yoga and would love to support
children in Nepal learning yoga. Talk about this campaign in class, and share it in your newsletter. While we are visiting the US you can even organize an event in your center and Yogi Prakash can teach class or offer yoga philosophy discourse.  
#4 Throw
a party. That’s right, we want people to host parties all over the world.
Invite your friends and family, grab some veggies and hummus and watch our
video together. You can also check out other videos on our Youtube Channel
(Shanti Yoga Ashram). Then take some pics and email them to us and we will add

#5 Already
hosting an event? If you are hosting an event between Jan 12-Feb 24 you can share

story:
The Dolphins are Calling! 


Dolphin Assited CranioSacral Therapy is an amazing and effective healing modality. It has been used extensively to bring healing and improved quality of life to individuals with Cerebral Palsy, Parkinson's, Brain Injury and so much more. 

About me: I am an avid student of the healing arts for over 10 years and am hungry for more. I am a licensed Acupuncturist in California, Chinese herbalist, and CranioSacral therapist. I envision a world where all are intimately connected with the innate healing capacity of the body. This connection supports personal well being and radiates healing to our relationships, our families, our communities and our world. 

Healing the world with our hearts and hands, one moment at a time <3


What is Dolphin Assisted Therapy and Why is it Important?

Developed by osteopath John Upledger, CranioSacral Therapy (CST) involves a gentle, noninvasive touch focused on identifying and freeing restrictions in the body’s craniosacral system — the membranes and cerebrospinal fluids surrounding the brain and spinal cord. Dysfunction in this system may cause sensory, neurological, and motor imbalances, and freeing the natural flow can allow the body to self-correct. The institute’s initial pilot project with dolphins focused on seven children, aged 5 to 12, diagnosed with a variety of ailments, such as cerebral palsy, brain injury, and epilepsy. Working as a three-member team, therapists provided both physical support of the client in the water and a multi-hand approach. Water sessions were alternated with table work on a floating dock adjacent to the dolphins’ lagoon. Facilitating release through CST in water takes a fraction of the time needed on land. In addition to this speeded up process, buoyancy experienced in the water provides a feeling of support and allows for body positioning that would be more difficult on the treatment table. 

In an independent research report from the Upledger Foundation (1997), patients’ responses to the dolphin-assisted CST were stated as “quite significant and included substantial reduction in pain, increased ease in breathing, greater general relaxation and specific reduction of hypertonicity, enhanced strength and flexibility, increased appetite, and more restful sleep.”

The body organizes itself around whatever is stuck. As we do CranioSacral Therapy, we are gently disorganizing those areas of restrictions. This allows the system to reorganize in a more functional, efficient way.  Changes in mood, appetite, sleep, pain, muscle tone, digestion, and elimination are all possible effects. CranioSacral Therapy engages with the body’s self-correcting processes.


Why I Need You!


I am enrolled to attend the Upledger Institute's Bioaquatic Explorations: SomatoEmotinal Release course at the end of August and I NEED YOUR HELP TO MAKE IT SO! I have been pursuing this course of study for 3 years. Beyond realizing a deep personal goal, this course signifies the important connection and collaboration of animals and humans in the healing of our planet. Animals are full of deep wisdom if we pause to listen. Working directly with animals reconnects us to larger truths of life, beyond the limitations of modern culture. 

My big big vision includes a healing retreat center including Equine and Canine assisted therapies. Attending this course is just one step along the path!

Ok! The nuts and bolts!

I am raising $4200 to cover expenses. 

-1500$ for the course 

~1050$ transportation costs

~1500$ room and board

and a little extra to cover the campaign fees.

Check out all the perks! This is an exciting way to connect with me and all of the various skills I have been polishing these last 10 years. And to help catapult me to the next level of my practice! Want a custom perk? Lets brainstorm! 

Email me at pearltraditionalarts@gmail.com for more info!


Everything Helps!


I am deeply grateful for any and all contributions, big or small. Whether you can contribute or not, everyone can SHARE! 

All funds beyond the goal amount will go directly toward further BioAquatics courses. If the goal amount is not met all funds raised will still go toward this trip! 

<3<3  THANK YOU FOR ALL OF YOUR SUPPORT! SHARE AND ENJOY! <3<3
