story:
Short Summary

My name is Rachael Asher and I am 20 years old. I have always wanted to study in Europe and after years of trying and saving I finally have a visa for education in Belgium, and although I have spent the past two years saving money so I can do it, a little help from others never hurt!

I have been an honor roll student my entire life, making the deans list both semesters I was enrolled in college in the US. I plan to continue my good academic past in Antwerp, as well as push myself harder to achieve greater things.

My set date to move is September 15th. I will be leaving behind almost all of my belongings and friends in the USA. It will be a hard transition, but my boyfriend and his family will be welcoming me to my new home in Antwerp.

I've been to Belgium twice now, both times with my hard earned money, and I absolutely fell in love with the city of Antwerp. Now, I get the chance to continue my studies in Belgium as well as be with a person I love very much.

What We Need & What You Get

So to break it down, here's an example of what a single 100 dollar donation could do. Each bullet represents an individual 100 dollar donation:

  • Pay for almost 2 weeks of rent!
  • Pay for my food for a month!
  • Buy me a cellphone and pay the bill for 6 months.
  • Buy me all the books I need for my first year of school.
  • Pay my health insurance for 2 months.
  • Buy me 9 round trip train tickets!
  • Pay for 1/8 of my school each year!

Keep in mind that donations are accepted in amounts lower than 100. This is just an easy way to explain where the money would go!

The Impact

Each and every donation allows me to stay longer in Belgium. I do plan on getting a work permit when I arrive as well as working through the holidays, but there are never any guarantees for employment, and I will need help!

  • This may not be for some huge charity or for a super awesome documentary, but it's about creating a future and living a dream to better myself and the world around me.
  • I've never had a previous campaign, but I did spend a lot of my highschool years volunteering through several projects including: Step up Cincinnati, Relay for Life, 5k For Haiti, and several others. Now, I find myself in the position to ask for help, instead of giving it.
  • For anyone who knows me, they know that I never ask for much. I don't like being a hinderance to people. It takes a lot for me to ask for help, no matter how much I need it.... But this is so important to me. It's been my whole life, and I hope that with your help, I can continue to live my dream.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • If you can't offer a monetary donation, that's okay! Spreading the word about this campaign will help as well.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Promises for Families Foundation

Promises for Families is a non-profit organization that serves families and children with a parent incarcerated.  When a child's parent goes to prison, life as they know it ends.  They enter a grieving process just as any of us do when a loved one is taken from our midst.  We provide summer camp and after school programming for children by partnering with other organizations (churches, YMCA, scouting groups, and community outreach service providers) to efficiently use precious human and financial resources.


The Impact

On any given day in America, 1.5 million children have a parent incarcerated.  More than 10 million are living with a parent who has come under some sort of criminal justice supervision during the child's life.  The challenges faced by these families are significant.  Not only do they face the trauma of loss and grief, but also a range of social and economic challenges.  We strive to provide trained professionals to mentor these children with the hope of breaking the cycle of inter-generational incarceration.


Our Programs and What Is Needed

Our program uses four components - music, movement, art, and nature.  Health RhythmsⓇ recreational music protocol is an evidence based program proven to promote health and wellness in many populations.  Health RhythmsⓇ is complemented with YogaKidsⓇ, the preeminent children's yoga program endorsed by many health care professionals.  Art and Nature therapy round out the program, and the four components combine to address the needs of the whole child.  Funds raised through IndieGoGo will be used to purchase musical instruments, equipment, art supplies, and a small trailer to transport equipment to and from program sites.  All of our staff are trained in their respective disciplines.  Our music director, Mr. Arthur Thompson, has been working with at-risk youth for fifteen years, and is a master drum circle facilitator.  Our director, Mrs. Katy Hoskins, has certifications in counseling and art education, and is a YogaKidsⓇ instructor.  We have additional staff that are specialized in outdoor activities, tai chi, aerobic dance, and even equine therapy. On April 4th, a donor offered to match, dollar for dollar, contributions made through IndieGogo up to $2,500....your gift will be doubled!


Other Ways You Can Help

Please check out our web site  www.promisesforfamilies.org .  You can find opportunities to volunteer at a camp, donate supplies like toiletry items and towel for campers, or experience on of our programs.  Thank You!

story:
I could begin this by saying that I have been through the wringer over the last few years, and technically, it would be true. But I won't, because in spite of everything, I have been so, so blessed. Everytime my babies or I have needed something that I couldn't provide, someone else-loved ones, dear friends, my absolutely AMAZING mother and sister-has come through for us, and I can never thank them enough for everything they have done. I have to ask one more favor, but it is one that I pray will lead to a chance for me to start paying back everything that has been done for me and for my children.

For those of you who might not know, my name is Eva, and I am the divorced, single mom of a seven year-old daughter and a 5 year-old son. The originial goal of this campaign was to raise $1700 to cover my first semester of college tuition and books; however, as of this morning (26 Jul) a MAJOR problem seems to have been resolved and the amount of money that I need has dropped dramatically, to the point that I am confident that I can raise it in plenty of time to register for school. Buuuuuttt, indiegogo rules say that I cannot delete my campaign once contributions have been made, and I cannot change my original goal amount; with that in mind, I have decided to change the goal of my campaign, since I can't end it early. From here on out, whatever money is contributed to my campaign, above and beyond the approximately $200 or so I still need for textbooks, will be donated to Spartanburg Rape Crisis. They are a vital resource in my community, but their funding is so small in comparision to what they do for so many women in desperate need-even a small amount of money is welcome, but I am hoping that I can hand them so much more than a small amount when this campaign is completed.

 

Thank you so much to everyone who has already contributed! I am truly blessed!

 

                        Eva

story:
Our Story

Mac Ha village is located 7 km from Sapa town in Northern Vietnam.  It is the most impoverished area of the Sapa region and home to more then 1,000 Black H'mong ethnic minority people living in and around Ma Cha village. TET Lifestyle Collection supports the 150 children in the local school from kindergarten to 5th grade. Our long term focus is to continue to support the Ma Cha school so these children are able to have a more comfortable environment in which to learn, grow and develop.  As we believe education is the key to breaking the cycle of poverty.

 Before TET Lifestyle Collection support, most of these children had no shoes, many had no pants and they certainly had next to no school resources. Going to school in Winter for these children was and still is extremely difficult. Close your eyes and imagine for a moment what it must be like for these children to firstly walk up to 6km bare foot over rice fields to school each morning when the temperature in winter is often minus 5 degrees Celsius. Once at school the children sit in cold cement class rooms with no heating while the wind whistles through the broken windows and doors. 

TET Lifestyle Collection has continued its support for Ma Cha School for 8 years.  The past 5 years we have held our “Help Keep Us Warm” campaign. In December 2008, 2009, 2010, 2011, 2012 TET Lifestyle Collection donated USD4,000 of duck down jackets each year. This ear we need to raise enough money to purchase 200 jackets. These jackets have been fantastic in keeping our school students warm.  The time has come to purchase another set of jackets to keep the children warm this winter.  

Last years warm jackets on video

US$ 25 is all it costs to purchase one warm jacket.  If you donate US$ 50 your generosity will allow us to keep two children toasty warm this winter.  Warm your heart while you warm a child with your generosit

What We Need & What You Get

Already we have ordered and are making the jackets in Saigon, south Vietnam.  We choose Saigon as the quality of the jackets are the best while the cost is cheaper.  The jackets will be completed in time for winter December 2013.  

Our goal is to give each student at Ma Cha School a warm jacket by 25 December 2013... Please help us.

Watch our video

 If you donate US$ 50 your generosity will allow us to keep two children
toasty warm this winter.  Warm your heart while you warm a child with your
generosit
What We Need & What You Get
Already we have ordered and are making the jackets in
Saigon, south Vietnam.  We choose Saigon as the quality of the jackets are
the best while the cost is cheaper.  The jackets will be completed in time
for winter December 2013.  
Our goal is to give each student at Ma Cha School a warm
jacket by 25 December 2013... Please help us.
Watch our video

story:
Meet Rebecca---- A ChangeMaker. 

Born and raised in the Brooklyn Becky has dedicated her life to her community and to seeing others grow. She is a proud mother of 4 but her nurturing characteristics extend well outside of her home. Becky is a also, among other amazing many things, a role model and mentor to the many of the young people that she crosses paths with in her line of work.

These days, Becky spends 40 hours + a week as the Program Manager for a local community center that provides services for residents of Red Hook Houses, the largest public housing complex in Brooklyn, NY where she has lived for the last 11 years. There she manages a team and oversees the development of job readiness and training programs for unemployed young adults in the neighborhood. She has contributed over 10 years of her time to the organization and has a diverse employment history because of her commitment to growing and reaching new heights.

Becky is also a certified HIV testing counselor and a DYCD Family Development Training and Credentialing (FDC) counselor with extensive experience working on community health issues in Red Hook. She continues to look for opportunities and experiences that uplift her in her career and this time, she needs our help!

Building Momentum--- A Life's journey . 

Momentum Education is a series of self awareness workshops that have impacted the lives of thousands. Becky was fortunate enough to experience the first workshop but needs our help with getting to the next one! The price, $950. 
Why Momentum? The value that Becky received from the first, Basic Workshop, had a huge impact in changing her outlook on life. She has a desire to continue to explore the barriers in her life that are keeping her from reaching her full potential, faster.  She has always been motivated and a go-getter but, like most of us, can admit that there is always room for improvement. For Becky, this is her time to go as far as she can go to seek new and profound possibilities! Will you help?

Help us help Becky spread the word! 

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share with your friends and family using the sharing tools!

story:
I have been offered a place at the theatre school of my dreams! In September 2015 I will be attending the Bristol Old Vic Theatre School for its MA Acting program. 

Entry is highly competitive: over 1,700 applicants audition for the 28 acting places available each year. And they chose little old me!

About Me 

I am half Japanese, half British, raised in Ottawa, Canada. I earned my Political Science degree from McGill University and am a graduate from the full-time acting program at Vancouver Academy of Dramatic Arts (VADA). I've been holding a day job and doing acting gigs here and there for the past while.

Why am I doing this campaign?

I am short $9,000 CAD (~£4,500). For price breakdown please refer below.

Why fund me?

  • You would come see me perform in a show if you could. If anything, you could donate the amount you would spend on a ticket to see me in a play.
  • I am committed to social change- particularly via the arts. I am committed to taking part in creative projects that raise social and political awareness. For example, I am currently making a mini documentary about Basic Income. I regularly listen to the BBC and hungrily consume other news sources like Democracy Now! and what Russell Brand has to say. Your donation will go toward an artist committed to social change.
  • You are supporting a female ethnic minority. Females and ethnic minorities are still under-represented in theatre, film and television. Growing up I wish I saw more girls who looked like me on screen. Help make that change!
  • Having roots in a few cultures and being able to speak a few languages (English, French, Japanese and Italian), I have access and am accessible to a wide variety of markets and audience. I can be a microphone for different parts of the world, and I intend to use this powerfully.
  • This education will launch my career. It will open doors to my presence on the professional stage and in the UK market in a way I could never do on my own.
  • You'd like to support a young woman following her dreams. To receive classical theatre training is a decade-long dream come true!

Price Breakdown

EXPENSES:

  • Tuition: £19,500 = $40,000 CAD (roughly)
  • Living Expenses for 1 year in Bristol: $15,000 CAD
  • Total: $55,000 CAD

FUNDS SO FAR:

  • Student Line of Credit = $46,000 CAD
  • Ontario Government Loan = Unknown (I am applying for OSAP, but don't know if I'll get funding, or how much, considering I haven't been an Ontario resident for years. The BC government unfortunately doesn't recognize my school.)
NEEDED: $9,000 CAD

Don't feel you need to meet a certain donation level. $1 or $9000 and anything else in between is most appreciated and will help me attain my dream.

story:
The Mid-Atlantic Karst Conservancy (MAKC) is embarking upon this crowd funding effort for essential repairs to its Danielson Library and Educational Center. The MAKC insurance agent and the local building code enforcement have raised safety concerns about the exterior of the Center. Additionally, the building needs aesthetic improvement to better reflect the surrounding neighborhood. Please read about the MAKC, the Center, and the building issues below, and watch the short video about the project. Then, please make a contribution!

The MAKC was founded in the mid-1990s by western Pennsylvania cavers with a passion for protecting caves while providing access for scientific and recreational activities. The mission of the MAKC is to preserve caves and karst terrain in the mid-Atlantic region through the acquisition and leasing of properties with caves.  MAKC has acquired nine cave and karst preserves in Pennsylvania and West Virginia, totaling over 5,000 acres. Two of these properties are owned, and the remainder leased. These cave preserves are described in detail on the MAKC website, www.karst.org.

In the late 2000s, it was identified that protecting caves and karst areas were not the only important functions for the MAKC. With the aging and passing of long-time cavers, cave related literature and periodicals were also in need of protection for both current and future cavers.  Books, periodical collections, cave notes, maps, and other related documents were about to be lost for future generations to appreciate. The MAKC realized that these collections would likely be sold off, lost, and dispersed if nothing was done to preserve them. With this in mind, the MAKC began formulating the idea of acquiring a central location in the mid-Atlantic area where these collections and other materials from donors could be housed and used by current and future cave researchers.

The MAKC secured a commitment from Bob and Beverly Danielson for a sizable donation, along with other generous donors, to acquire property for a cave and karst library. With these commitments, the MAKC set about to locate a building that was sufficiently large enough to house the books and publications known to be available, yet also large enough to accommodate the future publication contributions. The Blairsville, Pennsylvania area was selected due to the number of active MAKC members living in proximity to this town, the location of many caves in the area, and because property values in the area were attractive. In 2009, an early 20th century, three bedroom house was identified in Blairsville at a very good price. The property was purchased with the grants, and the Danielson Library and Education Center was realized.

The house was in poor repair when purchased. Over the next several years, thousands of man hours and additional donations were used to redo much of the house interior. The house was rewired to bring to code, bathrooms redone, hardwood floors refinished, insulation added, and many other projects undertaken. Additionally, the collections of books and periodicals were contributed, cataloged, archived, and stored in the library. Many individuals and organizations contributed documents, but the major contributors to the library in the Danielson Center were Jack Stelmack (former NSS President), Dale Ibberson, and Jack Speece. While there are still some remaining interior projects, the inside has progressed well.

Our present need is to address the exterior of the building, and is the purpose of this crowd funding effort. Other than a door replacement and front stoop repairs, little has been done to the exterior. The local code enforcement officer and the MAKC insurance agent have pointed out several deficiencies that need to be addressed ASAP. The soffits, fascia and storm gutters are rotted and decayed, and are literally falling off the building! In addition, the roof has reached its life span and should be replaced. Additionally the surrounding neighborhood is pretty nice and the library is in need of painting to more closely match the condition of surrounding homes and buildings.

These repairs are beyond the skill sets of the many volunteers who have worked on the building interior. Exterior repairs will need to be completed by skilled and properly insured contractors. The total estimates for contracted work is $18,000. Our goal for this crowd funding campaign is $18,000. This will cover the contracted portions of the work. MAKC volunteers will do other exterior work, including landscaping, porch repairs, and other tasks, with separately donated funds.

Please view the video to  learn more about the Danielson Library and Educational Center, then make a contribution to this fund raising effort.

Thank you for taking the time to view and take interest in this crowd funding effort.

Dave Field, MAKC Chairman

story:
Molecule 3D

3D scanners are a great way to create models for 3D printing.  The problem is that most are either too expensive or too low quality for good 3D printing.

When we began work on the Molecule 3D scanner, our goal was to make sure it was extremely precise and easy to use. We considered every element that defined professional 3D scanners - the processors, cameras, build quality, turntable design, projected light scanners and laser based scanners. 

Sure, there are all kinds of 3D scanners today -- from projected light scanners that connect via a tablet that are handheld and fast, to traditional flat-bed/turntable scanners that are too often slow and stationary -- but none are accurate, unless you have $15,000 to spend. So we challenged ourselves to design and engineer a 3D scanner that not only was extremely precise and accurate but also fast, low cost and affordable.

Now you can shape a model of any objectives by Molecule 3D, which will definitely simplify your work, save your effort, and improve your efficiency considerably.

We make Molecule 3D to complete the Scan-to-Print solution in an easier and better way, With Molecule 3D, you can scan whatever object you like automatically, turn it into a digital 3D model on your computer. The standard STL format model is seamlessly compatible with any desktop 3D printers. You don’t even need to be a professional 3D model engineer, all the digital models are ready to print.



Molecule 3D  is provided in the form of kits.  No soldering or electrical knowledge is required to build the Molecule 3D kits.  All of the components simply screw together.  The user must print the plastic parts for each kit.

Inside the Box:

The Full Kit contains everything.  This includes 

1. Molecule 3D control board

2.  1.3megapixel CMOS sensor x2

3. Laser modules,

4. 5V power supply

5. Stepper motor

6. rubber coating, rubber feet, and all of the fasteners and cables.

7. User Manuel

8. Molecule 3D Scan application


Molecule 3D detail drawing


Technical Spec


Unit Size    210x218x405 mm


 Scan Volume  160 x200 mm


High and FOV Adjustment


 


How It Works: 

Molecule 3D works by illuminating an object with laser light and then using 3D triangulation to generate a point cloud for each location where the laser hits the model.  Neighboring points are then connected by triangles to form a 3D model.  This model can be used as-is for many purposes or it can be processed in a software package such as Meshlab to make it water-tight and print ready.

Easy to use, one-touch scanning

We believe that 3D scanning should be as simple as its 2D counterpart, and accessible to everyone. Yet today's 3D scanners are either very expensive or require significant effort to produce acceptable results. Many systems require the user to learn how to perform complex and tricky calibration. Most require the user to manually collect a set of 3D images around the object which must then be aligned and combined through post processing steps.

Our 3D scanner will change that. With the Molecule 3D you simply put your object into the scanner, press a button and scan. The result is a fully aligned and meshed colour point cloud. No alignment, no post processing, no training - although we encourage you to read the manual first! 

Molecule 3D in calibration


360 degree coverage

We have designed the Molecule 3D so that you can capture your object with the minimum of fuss. The system uses a turntable and two unique and patented scanning webcams, one to the side and one set above the object, to maximise coverage. The scanner is compatible with all major CAD packages and 3D printers, producing its output in .STL, .OBJ and .PLY formats.


Molecule 3D  in action



The team behind Molecule 3D



Why we need you

We’ve worked very hard over the past year to design Molecule 3D. With your support, we will be able to start the production and bring Molecule 3D to the global market. We have already established a network of suppliers and manufacturers for the various components. By investing in our project, you will ensure our current prototype turns into a real product available to world at large. Our goal is to produce 1000 units in the first batch. We need you to make this happen!

Risks and challenges

Molecule 3D, like all laser scanners, has trouble with shiny, black, and furry surfaces. However, most of the risks and challenges have already been overcome from the previous prototype and software iterations. The biggest risk that remains is the availability of quality components at low volume.

We've been working on developing the Molecule 3D Scanner for over a year. We've tested it countless times, learned a ton, refined the design and continue to make it better. 

Hardware is always challenging. And that is why we have made sure not to launch this campaign prematurely. We have already developed many aspects of the hardware and software to ensure there are no blindspots in our planning and forecasting for shipping deadlines.

We are in the process of testing and manufacturing the Molecule 3D scanner at scale. The indieGoGo campaign helps us gauge precisely how many units we'll need to manufacture.

We've put together the best team and resources behind this project to ensure your order arrives on time. We've set realistic deadlines. And we will keep you entirely posted along the way.


Project Schedule




Legal Disclaimer

"Delivery of rewards/perks are subject to best efforts and not guaranteed." 


Not Finish yet..............
We would like to offer a very special deal for our becker

Special Package: Lightsaber

VideoHello, this is Molecule 3D!

Molecule 3D  in action




Screenshot of Molecule 3D scan

This meant designing the product and it’s components taking into consideration the limitations and capabilities of actual industrial equipment and processes, Of the seven major prototypes that we iterated through in the last 12 months, only three were 3D Printed, the rest were machined on the very machines that will mass manufacture your molecule 3D scanners. This upcoming batch of pre-mass manufactured units helps us figure out a variety of things, such as the optimal cutting speed/feed rates and the overall manufacturing workflow. These units are also the ones we will be using for certification. As this is a critical last step before scaling to mass-manufacturing, more time spent carefully and diligently here pays big dividends in the future.


The team behind Molecule 3D














Why we need you

We’ve worked very hard over the past year to design Molecule 3D. With your support, we will be able to start the production and bring Molecule 3D to the global market. We need you to make this happen!

story:
Deux mots sur cette campagne

La Tournée de π est une initiative organisée par un groupe d'une quinzaine de doctorantes, doctorants, jeunes chercheuses et jeunes chercheurs en mathématiques de Lyon, Marseille et Paris, rassemblés autour d'un grand projet de diffusion des mathématiques.

Fidèles à notre esprit, nous ferons toujours tout notre possible pour que nos événements soient totalement gratuits et accessibles au plus large public, et nous travaillons chaque jour contre l'impossible... mais un petit coup de main nous aiderait beaucoup et nous ferait le plus grand plaisir !

Ce #crowdfunding a été conçu pour pouvoir réaliser un film officiel de la Tournée de π, afin de permettre au plus grand nombre de profiter de vidéos de qualité de nos spectacles. 

Alors, si les maths vous ont fait rêver pendant nos manifestations, si vous pensez que ces dernières doivent continuer à exister et, surtout, si vous voulez soutenir une équipe jeune et motivée d'étudiants, doctorants et jeunes chercheurs passionnée par la diffusion des sciences, aidez-nous à rejoindre notre objectif !

 

Merci,

l'equipe de l'Association Pi Day.

 

Dans les lignes qui suivent vous trouverez une description détaillée de notre projet, de l'Association Pi Day et de ce qu'on vous propose par cette campagne.

 

Qu'est-ce que la journée de π ?

La journée de π est une journée annuelle de célébration autour du nombre π, des mathématiques et des sciences en général, célébrée à travers le monde annuellement le 14 mars. Ce jour a été choisi en raison de l'écriture américaine 3.14 de la date du 14 mars, qui évoque la valeur décimale approchée du fameux nombre π. À Marseille, nous fêtons depuis 2013 cette constante qui fait tourner le monde, à grands renforts de tartes (pie en anglais) et autres réjouissances. Le but de notre journée est de divertir, instruire et bien sûr nourrir  un public affamé de science !

"Pourquoi célébrer le nombre π ?" Vous devez avoir envie de dire...bon pourquoi pas ? D'ailleurs on ne célèbre pas uniquement π, mais les mathématiques en général dans tout ce qu'elles ont de plus attrayant et vivant. Le nombre π est simplement devenu un symbole des mathématiques: on a tous fait la connaissance de π à l'école pour calculer la circonférence ou l'aire d'un cercle; on retrouve π partout dans notre quotidien (si si, les mathématiques sont partout, dans la cuisine, la musique, la magie et même les relations amoureuses !). 

La première journée de π fût organisée en 1988 par le physicien Larry Shaw à l'Exploratorium de San Francisco. L'événement comprenait notamment la dégustation de tartes (pie en anglais). Depuis, le concept s'est répandu et de nombreux événements divers ont eu lieu à travers le monde notamment dans la ville de Princeton, qui célèbre aussi par la même occasion l'anniversaire du célèbre physicien Albert Einstein.

L'association Pi day et notre philosophie

Le projet de la Tournée de π est porté par l’association Pi Day, association loi 1901, composée de doctorants et de jeunes chercheurs en mathématiques et informatique vivant pour la plupart en France, qui se consacre à la diffusion et la promotion des mathématiques et des sciences en général auprès du grand public.

Au-delà de l'organisation des Journées de π (tous les 14 mars à Marseille depuis 2013), on a participé à plusieurs événements de diffusion scientifique, comme la Fête de la Science (éditions 2015, 2016), le Salon Culture et Jeux Mathématiques (édition 2016) et le Forum des mathématiques vivantes (édition 2015), etc.

Pour l’originalité, l’ampleur et la réussite de ses activités, l’association a notamment reçu le prestigieux Prix d’Alembert de la Société de Mathématiques de France (SMF), récompensant les initiatives de diffusion mathématique auprès du large public. 

Afin de mobiliser l'attention et la réflexion du public, un gros travail sur la forme est nécessaire. Les séquences courtes (15 minutes) et diverses (exposés, comédie musicale) qui s'alternent permettent de garder l'attention du public, en combinant l'aspect attrayant d'un spectacle et profond d'un exposé scientifique.  

Nos objectifs sont d'attiser la curiosité du public sur des questions scientifiques (mathématiques, physiques, informatiques, etc.), de transmettre aux jeunes l'intérêt et la passion pour les mathématiques et les sciences, et bien sûr de faire passer au public une soirée agréable et divertissante !

Le spectacle

Le spectacle reprendra le modèle inédit qui a fait le succès de l’édition 2016 de la Journée de π : une comédie musicale mathématique entrelacée de 3 conférences scientifiques tout public de 15 minutes chacune, type TED, dans une grande salle de spectacle. Nous avons planché sur l'écriture d'une toute nouvelle comédie musicale pour cette année, et sommes impatients de vous la faire découvrir sur scène. 

L’ensemble de la soirée s’articule cette année autour du thème scientifique du hasard : les conférenciers apportent différents points de vue ou questions sur le hasard vu à travers le prisme de leurs différentes disciplines (probabilités, physique, informatique, épistémologie etc.).

La comédie musicale, From Marseille to Vegas, qui met en scène des jeunes chercheurs marseillais, aborde les thèmes des jeux de hasard, et du rôle grandissant des mathématiques dans la société.

    Les éditions précédentes de la Journée de π

    Notre équipe s’est formée en 2013 autour de la création d'un séminaire des doctorants à Marseille. Rapidement, le rendez-vous convivial entre doctorants et étudiants a cherché à attirer plus de monde. De là est née l'idée d'organiser des événements festifs et originaux pour aller vers le public. Le coup d'envoi est donné le 14 mars 2013 avec la Journée de π. L'événement, qui se déroule alors sur le campus de l'université, reprend le concept américain du π day. Au programme : un concours de tartes, un exposé de mathématiques, et la diffusion du film « Dimensions » par A. Alvarez, E. Ghys et J. Leys. La journée connaît un franc succès, couvert par la presse locale, qui encourage l'équipe à continuer.

    En 2014, la Journée de π a reçu des invités, dont Jean-Paul Delahaye, auteur notamment du livre « Le fascinant nombre π ».

    Journée de π 2015

    L'année 2015 fût très particulière puisque nous étions le 3.14.15 (plus précisément encore à 9h26 et 53 s, nous étions le 3.14.15 9:26:53) ! Nous avons donc mis les petits plats (à tarte) dans les grands pour une célébration en grande pompe totalement irrationnelle voire transcendante : la journée de π sort des murs de la fac pour toucher un public encore plus large, et prend un dimension résolument festive en faisant intervenir un orchestre de musique. Pour la première fois, le MuCEM (Musée des Civilisations de l'Europe et de la Méditerranée) a ouvert ses portes à un événement scientifique.

     

    La journée s'est articulé autour d'une matinée-spectacle avec des exposés tout public de vulgarisation attrayants, d'un concours de tartes avec des nombreux lots à gagner (dont un cours de pâtisserie) et d'une après midi d'ateliers et d'animations ludiques.

    La manifestation de 50 personnes la première année est devenue un événement de 500 personnes qui touche un public très divers de 0,7 à 77,7 ans.

    Journée de π 2016

    La formule de la conférence-comédie musicale a fait ses preuves en 2016, quand la Journée de π s’est déroulée au Théâtre National de la Criée. La soirée entrelaçait une comédie musicale mathématique sur la vie et les travaux scientifiques du savant grec Archimède, Les π travaux d’Archimède, et trois conférences tout public de 15 minutes.

    La journée de π était désormais devenue un événement théâtrale de 800 personne. Retrouvez toutes les vidéos de cette inoubliable journée sur notre sur notre chaine YouTube https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxDMMdKvE0Na8P...ou sur notre site www.piday.fr, ainsi que le programme complet de la soirée.  

     

    Helπ !

    La Tournée de π est en partie financée par des institutions liées au monde scientifique et étudiant (CNRS, Fondation A.M.U., Fondation Mathématique Jacques Hadamard, Société des Mathématiques Appliquées et Industrielles, INRIA et beaucoup d'autres - une liste complète est disponible sur notre site http://www.piday.fr/Partenaires/;). 

    Comment vous pouvez bien l'imaginer, l'organisation de trois soirées spectacle entièrement gratuites dans toute la France demande beaucoup de ressources, à la fois humaines et financières ! Pour cette raison le financement participatif est une occasion, à la fois, de soutenir notre projet et de permettre au plus grand nombre de participer aux activités de l'Association Pi Day !

    En choisissant une de nos contreparties (de valeur pπ, pour certains p premiers), vous pourrez profiter de nombreux gadgets originaux liés au nombre π, en plus de la captation intégrale du spectacle :

    le passeπ, votre passeport pour le monde des maths, nos désormais fameux crayons de π, un π en LEGO, les affiches officielles de la Tournée de Pi 2017, ainsi que les nouveaux t-shirts de l'association Pi Day et un génial jeu de cartes de π !

    Le but de 5000 euros sera destiné au financement des professionnels qui réaliseront la captation vidéo/photo sur les trois soirées. Une captation de qualité est essentielle pour pouvoir diffuser en ligne des bonnes vidéos des soirées. 

    Bien sûr, toute autre forme de participation, partage ou curiosité que notre aventure vous suggère est la bienvenue ! La Tournée de π est tout d'abord le résultat du travail d'une petite communauté fait d'amis et de gens qui aiment bien s'amuser et se nourrir ensemble autour des maths ! Contactez-nous à l'adresse staff-2017@piday.fr.

    Mathématiquement,

    l'equipe de l'Association Pi Day

     

    _________________________________

    Retrouvez l'Association Pi Day sur :

    Website : http://www.piday.fr
    Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pidaymars/?ref=ts&...
    Twitter: https://twitter.com/pidaymars
    Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/pidaymarseille/
story_txt: Deux mots sur cette campagneLa Tournée de π est une initiative organisée par un groupe d'une quinzaine de doctorantes, doctorants, jeunes chercheuses et jeunes chercheurs en mathématiques de Lyon, Marseille et Paris, rassemblés autour d'un grand projet de diffusion des mathématiques.Fidèles à notre esprit, nous ferons toujours tout notre possible pour que nos événements soient totalement gratuits et accessibles au plus large public, et nous travaillons chaque jour contre l'impossible... mais un petit coup de main nous aiderait beaucoup et nous ferait le plus grand plaisir !Ce #crowdfunding a été conçu pour pouvoir réaliser un film officiel de la Tournée de π, afin de permettre au plus grand nombre de profiter de vidéos de qualité de nos spectacles. Alors, si les maths vous ont fait rêver pendant nos manifestations, si vous pensez que ces dernières doivent continuer à exister et, surtout, si vous voulez soutenir une équipe jeune et motivée d'étudiants, doctorants et jeunes chercheurs passionnée par la diffusion des sciences, aidez-nous à rejoindre notre objectif ! Merci,l'equipe de l'Association Pi Day. Dans les lignes qui suivent vous trouverez une description détaillée de notre projet, de l'Association Pi Day et de ce qu'on vous propose par cette campagne. Qu'est-ce que la journée de π ?La journée de π est une journée annuelle de célébration autour du nombre π, des mathématiques et des sciences en général, célébrée à travers le monde annuellement le 14 mars. story:
Short Summary

Around the world, people are standing up for freedom. Whether in Baltimore or Charleston, Iraq or India, there has never been a time when so many joined the fight for justice and dignity.

The Court Street School Education Community Center represents an essential dimension of this struggle over the last century. Founded as a segregated school for African Americans, it shaped the Civil Rights Movement in New Jersey that inspired historic figures like Martin Luther King, Jr., Paul Robeson, Ella Baker, and Florence Randolph.

After an initial restoration in 1996, a new generation of leaders have sustained these traditions at the Court Street School. Recently, however, vandalism has scarred this sacred location. As a result, our programs have been suspended until we can repair the damage. This crisis occurred less than two months before our centennial celebration. 

Please donate today and help us continue this vital work into a second century.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $7500 to repair our air conditioning units, protect it with a new fence , and install digital surveillance to deter future vandals.

Contributors will receive updates about our progress and special invitations to all of the Centennial programs.

Any contributions help! Even if we miss our goal, we will be able to complete some of the work described here.

The Impact

The Court Street School is one of only two surviving sites where African American youth were educated during the peak of Jim Crow segregation in New Jersey. Because so much of this past has been erased, your gift today assures that the struggle for universal freedom - its victories, its defeats, and its sacrifices - will never be forgotten.

Thousands of young people have benefited from our work through tutoring programs, enrichment events, summer bible school, and college scholarships. Please join us today, so that we can survive this recent setback.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute today, please share this announcement with friends, family, and community leaders who might be interested.

Our gratitude for your time, attention, and support is boundless.

story:
Join us in developing Santa Fe Art Institute (SFAI) as Santa Fe's hub for creative social change! We are renovating our space to create a more engaging environment for our community, residency, education, and social entrepreneurship programming. Your support will contribute to making Santa Fe a nexus for innovative social change. 

At SFAI, we believe in blue sky thinking: as an interdisciplinary institution we can serve as a center for developing creative approaches to address the most pressing issues of our times.

Santa Fe Art Institute (SFAI) is a cultural organization that seeks to address a critical question: how can SFAI cultivate creative practices (from fine art to design to urban planning and beyond), engage with diverse communities, and address the most pressing social issues of our time?

SFAI is a hub for creative engagement and social change. We facilitate this through a renowned residency program bringing together creative practitioners from all over the world, to educational programming that includes the groundbreaking Design Workshop, and public programs that celebrate local innovators and activists like SFAI 140 and Conversations @ SFAI.

Our building, built in 1999 by the Mexican architect Ricardo Legorreta, has played host to over 1,000 artists in residence and numerous public programs.  Since that time SFAI has grown. With that in mind, we need to expand access to our courtyard and kitchen space in order to provide our community with more inclusive programming like workshops, group dinners, receptions, and retreats.  

These renovations will include installing large glass doors to provide direct access to our courtyard and an open chef style kitchen - more conducive to conversations, engaging events, and communal housing. We’re hoping to have these renovations completed by the end of the year so that 2016 can usher in another term of exciting program development.

With your contribution, you buy into creating innovative approaches for positive social change. If you believe in the role creativity plays in public education, if you believe in the benefit of cultivating exchanges with local, national, and international artists, if you believe in supporting social innovation in Northern New Mexico, then contribute to SFAI. 

We are hosting several public events that coincide with our campaign this summer. We look forward to seeing you! Participate in our engaging programming and network with the dynamic SFAI community. For more information on each event, visit WWW.SFAI.ORG

JUNE 20, 11-3PM LUNCH @ SFAI: A Celebration of Food Justice, RSVP Required

JULY 16, 7-9PM Georgina Lightning @ SFAI: Advance Preview Screening of Fantasies of Flying

JULY 23, 7-9PM SFAI 140: An Evening of Creativity & Conversation


With your contribution, you buy into creating innovative approaches to positive social change. Complex problems require interdisciplinary solutions. At SFAI, we bring together artists, architects, designers, writers, local community partners, and national arts organizations to develop solutions to the most pressing issues of our time.

Your contribution means 3 things to SFAI:

1. It allows us to greatly enhance our programming in capacity and scale.

2. It helps provide a better experience for our gifted artists in residence.

3. It gives you more opportunities to participate in what SFAI has to offer.

All contributions are tax deductible. Contributors that live within 75 miles of Santa Fe will pick up their gifts directly at SFAI, all others will be shipped. Any questions? Contact SFAI at 505.424.5050

AMOUNT 

NAME  

DESCRIPTION

10

Fan

2K

3.5K

Producers Council

2 Named Residency Fellowships in 2015-16

Perpetual Named Residency Fellowship

5K+

Champions Council

Naming of Renovation Space

SFAI’s dynamic programming is based in four areas: education, residency, community events, and social entrepreneurship.  Whichever way you engage with the world, our four programmatic areas address the type of creative approach to social change you believe in.

SFAI’s International Program continues to grow and expand to serve the needs of artists and foster invaluable relationships within our local community. SFAI implements yearlong thematic programing that address pertinent questions facing diverse regional and global communities.

By hosting residencies for artists and writers, fostering partnerships with cultural and educational organizations, and integrating education initiatives, SFAI brings together creative practitioners to address the greatest needs of our times.

SFAI is committed to education programming that reflects our values and that drives our broader vision as a hub for creative practice and critical community engagement. We are honored to serve you and your families through our endeavors, and we hope that you will continue to support us as we explore how innovative, collaborative curriculum can positively impact our youth.

SFAI hosts a compelling diversity of events, from CONVERSATIONS @ SFAI, to community partner driven workshops, and SFAI 140. SFAI 140, our marquee event, is an evening of creativity and conversation featuring 20 short talks by some of the area’s most innovative thinkers and practitioners. It is a quarterly event in which artists, members of the community, and leaders of cultural organizations discuss ideas and projects in lightning-fast presentations: 20 speakers with a total of 140 seconds each.

SFAI Works is a social entrepreneurship incubator that supports New Mexico entrepreneurs engaged in promoting social change through creativity. SFAI Works brings together entrepreneurs who have an idea for developing a project, system, or network that responds to a pressing issue, can have a statewide impact, and shares SFAI values. The incubator combines a series of workshops, presentations, and network building as a way of jumpstarting the success of each cohort. At the core of SFAI Works is a belief that mentorship in a supportive environment can directly contribute to the growth of individuals and their creative economies.

Follow us on social media to learn more about our programming, join upcoming events, connect with others, and spread the word about the campaign!

FACEBOOK.COM/SANTAFEARTINSTITUTE

TWITTER.COM/SFAI

INSTAGRAM.COM/SANTAFEARTINSTITUTE

VIMEO.COM/SFAI
story_txt:
Join us in developing Santa Fe Art Institute (SFAI) as Santa Fe's hub for creative social change! We are renovating our space to create a more engaging environment for our community, residency, education, and social entrepreneurship programming. Your support will contribute to making Santa Fe a nexus for innovative social change. At SFAI, we believe in blue sky thinking: as an interdisciplinary institution we can serve as a center for developing creative approaches to address the most pressing issues of our times.Santa Fe Art Institute (SFAI) is a cultural organization that seeks to address a critical question: how can SFAI cultivate creative practices (from fine art to design to urban planning and beyond), engage with diverse communities, and address the most pressing social issues of our time?SFAI is a hub for creative engagement and social change. We facilitate this through a renowned residency program bringing together creative practitioners from all over the world, to educational programming that includes the groundbreaking Design Workshop, and public programs that celebrate local innovators and activists like SFAI 140 and Conversations @ SFAI. Our building, built in 1999 by the Mexican architect Ricardo Legorreta, has played host to over 1,000 artists in residence and numerous public programs.  Since that time SFAI has grown. With that in mind, we need to expand access to our courtyard and kitchen space in order to provide our community with more inclusive programming like workshops, group dinners, receptions, and retreats.  These renovations will include installing large glass doors to provide direct access to our courtyard and an open chef style kitchen - more conducive to conversations, engaging events, and communal housing. We’re hoping to have these renovations completed by the end of the year so that 2016 can usher in another term of exciting program development. With your contribution, you buy into creating innovative approaches for positive social change. If you believe in the role creativity plays in public education, if you believe in the benefit of cultivating exchanges with local, national, and international artists, if you believe in supporting social innovation in Northern New Mexico, then contribute to SFAI. We are hosting several public events that coincide with our campaign this summer. We look forward to seeing you! Participate in our engaging programming and network with the dynamic SFAI community. For more information on each event, visit WWW.SFAI.ORGJUNE 20, 11-3PM LUNCH @ SFAI: A Celebration of Food Justice, RSVP RequiredJULY 16, 7-9PM Georgina Lightning @ SFAI: Advance Preview Screening of Fantasies of FlyingJULY 23, 7-9PM SFAI 140: An Evening of Creativity & Conversation With your contribution, you buy into creating innovative approaches to positive social change. Complex problems require interdisciplinary solutions. At SFAI, we bring together artists, architects, designers, writers, local community partners, and national arts organizations to develop solutions to the most pressing issues of our time.Your contribution means 3 things to SFAI:1. It allows us to greatly enhance our programming in capacity and scale.2. It helps provide a better experience for our gifted artists in residence.3. It gives you more opportunities to participate in what SFAI has to offer.All contributions are tax deductible. Contributors that live within 75 miles of Santa Fe will pick up their gifts directly at SFAI, all others will be shipped. Any questions? Contact SFAI at 505.424.5050

SFAI’s dynamic programming is based in four areas: education, residency, community events, and social entrepreneurship.  Whichever way you engage with the world, our four programmatic areas address the type of creative approach to social change you believe in.SFAI’s International Program continues to grow and expand to serve the needs of artists and foster invaluable relationships within our local community. SFAI implements yearlong thematic programing that address pertinent questions facing diverse regional and global communities. 
By hosting residencies for artists and writers, fostering partnerships with cultural and educational organizations, and integrating education initiatives, SFAI brings together creative practitioners to address the greatest needs of our times.SFAI is committed to education programming that reflects our values and that drives our broader vision as a hub for creative practice and critical community engagement. We are honored to serve you and your families through our endeavors, and we hope that you will continue to support us as we explore how innovative, collaborative curriculum can positively impact our youth.SFAI hosts a compelling diversity of events, from CONVERSATIONS @ SFAI, to community partner driven workshops, and SFAI 140. SFAI 140, our marquee event, is an evening of creativity and conversation featuring 20 short talks by some of the area’s most innovative thinkers and practitioners. It is a quarterly event in which artists, members of the community, and leaders of cultural organizations discuss ideas and projects in lightning-fast presentations: 20 speakers with a total of 140 seconds each.SFAI Works is a social entrepreneurship incubator that supports New Mexico entrepreneurs engaged in promoting social change through creativity. SFAI Works brings together entrepreneurs who have an idea for developing a project, system, or network that responds to a pressing issue, can have a statewide impact, and shares SFAI values. The incubator combines a series of workshops, presentations, and network building as a way of jumpstarting the success of each cohort. At the core of SFAI Works is a belief that mentorship in a supportive environment can directly contribute to the growth of individuals and their creative economies.Follow us on social media to learn more about our programming, join upcoming events, connect with others, and spread the word about the campaign!FACEBOOK.COM/SANTAFEARTINSTITUTETWITTER.COM/SFAIINSTAGRAM.COM/SANTAFEARTINSTITUTEVIMEO.COM/SFAI

story:
Short Summary

Fresh off the best men’s basketball season in school history, the program has momentum and has significantly increased the number of men’s basketball players that are transferring to play on scholarship at four year universities. After being invited to compete in one of the best community college tournaments in California, we decided that this was an incredible opportunity for our student athletes. The Clippers were also able to secure an extra single game so the trip is full of as many games as possible.

The exposure this opportunity will provide our program will be invaluable. Our student athletes will play in a high profile tournament in front of four year coaches who normally wouldn’t get to see our players compete in person. This will enhance their recruiting opportunities and also give our program a chance to extend our name beyond the Pacific Northwest.

The student athlete experience will be incredible. Students will get to travel together and visit places they normally wouldn’t visit in a typical season. This will be a wonderful life experience but also help them develop relationships and strengthen the team.

 

What We Need 

Our student athletes needs to raise $20,000 to cover the cost of airfare, rental vans, hotel, meals, and other expenses during the tournament.  We are so excited about this opportunity, and hope you will support us in our fundraising goals.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Please share using the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Come to a home game at SPSCC and see us in action!

story:
*****UPDATE 2 - Oct 1st 2016 - we have so far tonight, 33 candidate interviews and will have about 40 - 50 by the end of the upcoming week; money isn't the only way you can help - share the interviews - show what is possible - ask other media to interview these candidates.  THANK YOU to the people who donated money (very much) I am going to donate some of my own money also to the purpose of advertising - you can still contribute and continue to help - please visit our website to watch the interviews and get more info, even though this crowdfund campaign's about to end the story per se continues . . . at libertarianprogressive.com
 
*****UPDATE - Sept 27th 2016 - we 5 have days left until this crowdfund is over - we have 41 days until the election - so far we have 25 independent and 3rd party candidate interviews (across the spectrum) - these candidates are on the ballot and the only 3rd option in their district - by the end of the week we will have over 30 - spread the Word - every donation you give will go to advertising these candidates as a whole - even $5 will help - do what you can, share the interviews also - and thanks . . .
 
This is restated from the What We Need / What You Get section below BUT it is the main point & why we are asking for your help (and to envision this campaign), BTW I hear many people say "I have never heard of any other candidates running in my area from the media" - let's change that ASAP :
DISPLAY ADS - Tons of them - (mostly YouTube, some newspapers/publications & some radio) - This is one of the most important aspects - it doesn't do much good to offer news about options if no one is aware they exist.  This will reach millions of people, resulting in questioning status quo thinking, it will open hearts and minds creating new neural networks to newly discovered possibilities and encourage thinking outside the box per se, it will build the foundation for media who don't ignore (on the ballot) independent and third party candidates.  Who, what, when, where & WHY type questions. 
Imagine watching YouTube and / or seeing display ads in media asking: 
1. Do you know all your options this year for Congress? 
2. Have you considered this year voting for an independent or third party candidate? 
3. Have you researched all of the candidates in your local elections yet before you vote this November, do you know where to look? 
4. Would you like to participate in making: the environment in America better for small and mid-sized businesses?  Cannabis Legal?  A more peaceful and prosperous world? 
5. Would you be opposed to living during a new Renaissance? 
6. Why doesn't the media usually cover, nor invite to political debates, independent and third party candidates who earned being on the ballot? 
7. Do you know what unites most everyone? 
8. Does fair competition matter regarding better options?  Would more competition in politics result in Representatives being more responsive?  Did you know almost all other first world countries have more competition in their politics than the US? 
9. Does Congress exist to represent and serve the people who elect them or do the people exist to serve them?  i.e. who's in charge?  If you were a professional writer and you had an agent and they ripped you off, would you fire them or give them a raise? 
10. etc. 
Right now, overwhelmingly, almost all ads shown are usually over the top silly and are about Trump, Obama and Clinton and have silly questions with them.  Imagine a flood of strategic ads in popular venues that are thought provoking, intelligent and will take people to our websites which shows them 50+ qualified candidates, well presented along with resources to research more.  There quite is a vacuum regarding this information right now.
 
Ride the Wave campaign - Part 1 of 5 :

LibertarianProgressive.com is an independent, up & coming media organization.

We interview independent and 3rd party candidates who are on the ballot (Green Party, independents, Libertarians, No Party Affiliation and other parties).

We believe if a candidate has gathered enough signatures to be on the ballot and has a statistical chance to win then a responsible media will include them in the debates and interview them, to educate and inform the public of their options.

Our goal is to interview 50+ candidates every 2 year election cycle (mainly for the US House of Representatives, but not exclusively) & reach a large audience.

In 2012 we interviewed 50+ on the ballot, independent and third party candidates running for the US House & Senate from a full spectrum of American politics (to our knowledge this is the most independent and third party interviews conducted by one organization in a campaign season).

We tried to exclusively conduct interviews where the candidate was the only 3rd option and will continue to do so (to build consensus).  We launched in 2012 - it was a passion of love for truth - we exercised our responsibility and our right of a free press to get the word out.

2016 - Your support is important to grow LibertarianProgressive.com for 2016, 2018, 2020 and beyond.  We want to reach a much larger audience via macro-advertising (w/ better production quality).  Now that the primaries are over - you will be seeing more interviews consistently every day - most people usually start paying attention to the elections a month in.

2016 - Ride the Wave - Part 2 - The fundamental questions

What does LibertarianProgressive mean?  What is consensus?
There are about 324 million people in the USA.
There are about 219 million people eligible to vote and about 146 million registered to vote.
42% are independent
29% are Democrats
26% are Republicans
<1% are special interests
Who has the most influence do you think?

If there were 10 issues important to you, and 5 issues had popular consensus and 5 didn't, which 5 would you prioritize first?

LibertarianProgressive is advocating uniting and winning, instead of being divided & conquered.

There will be plenty of time to argue on things that we disagree about AFTER we pass legislation regarding important things we agree upon :

1. Accountability & Transparency reforms, freedom of information, integrity safeguards, auditing our government.

2. Civil Liberties, NSA privacy & spying, preserving the Bill of Rights, due process.

3. Corporate Cronyism, Lobbyists, no bid contracts, bailouts, the revolving door.

4. Military Spending, mission creep, regime change foreign policy, Congressional approval & oversight.

5. Ending the Drug War, reform the justice system, asset forfeiture, demilitarization of police, private prisons, mandatory minimums, quotas, racial profiling, industrial hemp.

6. Election reform, open primaries, Election Day holiday, fair debates, rank or score voting, none of the above option, paper trail.

7. Fair and Free Trade.

8. Promoting an environment of growth and opportunity, less regulation and more competition for small and mid-sized businesses.

There are 435 members in the US House of Representatives, elected every 2 years - it was designed that way on purpose, to be the least resistant, most peaceful and quickest path to reform, in our democratically elected Republic.

Talking with people regarding Congress is a lot less divisive then Presidential politics.

2016 - Ride the Wave - Part 3 - What does LibertarianProgressive mean? What is consensus? (above as main video)
 

What We Need & What You Get

$22,000 =

  • $17,000+ - Display Ads (mostly YouTube, some newspapers/publications & some radio) - This is one of the most important aspects - it doesn't do much good to offer news about options if no one is aware they exist.  This will reach millions of people, resulting in questioning status quo thinking, it will open hearts and minds creating new neural networks to previously undiscovered possibilities and encourage thinking outside the box per se, it will build the foundation for media who don't ignore (on the ballot) independent and third party candidates.  Who, what, when, where & WHY type questions.  Imagine watching YouTube and / or seeing display ads in media asking:  1. Do you know all your options this year for Congress?  2. Have you considered this year voting for an independent or third party candidate?  3. Have you researched all of the candidates in your local elections yet before you vote this November, do you know where to look?  4. Would you like to participate in making: the environment in America better for small and mid-sized businesses?  Cannabis Legal?  A more peaceful and prosperous world?  5. Would you be opposed to living during a new Renaissance?  6. Why doesn't the media usually cover, nor invite to political debates, independent and third party candidates who earned being on the ballot?  7. Do you know what unites most everyone?  8. Does fair competition matter regarding better options?  Would more competition in politics result in Representatives being more responsive?  Did you know almost all other first world countries have more competition in their politics than the US?  9. Does Congress exist to represent and serve the people who elect them or do the people exist to serve them?  i.e. who's in charge?  If you were a professional writer and you had an agent and they ripped you off, would you fire them or give them a raise?  10. etc.  Right now, overwhelmingly, almost all ads shown are usually over the top silly and are about Trump, Obama and Clinton and have silly questions with them.  Imagine a flood of strategic ads in popular venues that are thought provoking, intelligent and will take people to our websites which shows them 50+ qualified candidates, well presented along with resources to research more.  There quite is a vacuum regarding this information right now.
  • $4000 - Operations/Staff Help - This will help us dedicate more time towards building this organization for the future and present.
  • $1000 - Website and Audio/Video Production - When you watch the 50 interviews which will be about 500 hours and visit our website - it will be presented with a good quality, that will also help the impression of candidates being interviewed.
  • Your support will also contribute to living in a country where people are more informed and open to positive reform.

2016 - Ride the Wave - Part 4 of 5 - What if this was Congress?

 

2016 - Ride the Wave - Part 5 video - {coming soon}
 

The Impact

Most states have independent and third party candidates on the ballot (running for many different offices).  Please check your Department of Elections, and our resources, for more information.

We are not telling people who to vote for, rather, we are asking questions and presenting news about options, endorsing a more fair system.

The reason for the goal of 50+ interviews, of independent and 3rd party candidates on the ballot, every 2 year (US House) election season is - 50 represents one for each state.

  • Imagine if, We the People, elected even one independent or third party representative to Congress - in each of the 50 states.  If that goal is seen as a national movement, perhaps it might make it easier for independent and third party candidates - they could ~ ride the wave.
     

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize probably not everyone is always able to contribute money; however, if you contribute by spreading the word, sharing the links - & etc. that is truly appreciated & thank you.

LibertarianProgressive.com - also has a product & support page,

and an Amazon affiliate link - https://www.amazon.com/?tag=tgmcs-20
 

Does competition matter?
The fundamental question is Not : whether one should vote for independent or 3rd party candidates - Rather : WHY? DO REPUBLICANS & DEMOCRATS REPRESS EQUAL COMPETITION IN DEBATES AND ELECTIONS? Who are they disallowing? (ask yourself this) because if they do that to Them - they ARE doing it to You and to all of Us - we ARE the independents and 3rd party's; as more people realize this (and the consequences thereof) there will be more questions, options, relevant information and choices.
Is WHAT matters : HOW the game is played?

story:
We are a group of students at the University of Tennessee in the Haslam College of Business. We are also members of Venture, a living learning community focused on business. This semester we are taking English 255 Public Writing partnering with Junior Achievement of East Tennessee to help raise awareness of the organization in addition to the funds needed to help run BizTown. With your help, we will be able to expand the BizTown program and teach more students the importance of business in the world.

What is Junior Achievement? 

  Junior Achievement is the largest non-profit organization teaching kids about business, economics, and free enterprise in the world. Their mission is “to inspire young people to succeed in a global economy.” They partner with volunteers, educators, and the business community to encourage youth to reach their maximum potential. Specifically, the chapter in East Tennessee focuses on 17 counties, serving over 16,000 students. Junior Achievement of East Tennessee (JAET) reaches students in three ways: classroom visits, job shadowing, and BizTown. For more information about what Junior Achievement is and what they stand for, visit their page

What is BizTown?

  BizTown is by far the most unique experience offered by JAET. BizTown is a hands-on learning program that allows students to run a miniature town for a day. As Chip Reed, President of the JAET chapter, would say, “There is nothing like learning by doing.” Although these kids aren’t old enough to vote or drive, they can operate their own businesses. Students spend a whole day working together to help keep the town running efficiently by keeping their businesses up and running through the skills they will learn at the beginning of the program. They are able to learn how businesses interact with each other to keep a community running smoothly through first-hand experience.

Why do we need to raise funds?

  There is a scarcity in BizTown! We need supplies for each of the businesses to run smoothly. We will be allocating all funds earned to restock supplies in each business. Examples of the supplies needed include paper for the News Sentinel mock business, electronic equipment for the entrepreneur station, stuffed animals for the pet store, and much more!

  If we are unable to reach our goal of $1500, all of the money will still be allocated to BizTown for supplies. JAET will prioritize what businesses need the most help with funding and will be distributed to these stores accordingly.

What do you get?

  Not only do you get the satisfaction of making a difference in a child’s life and helping them learn and grow, but you get sweet perks too!

  For $5 – Virtual High-Five

  For $10 – Gold Star

  For $25 – Shout out on Facebook

  For $50 – Haslam College of Business pen

  For $75 – Pop-up bank

  For $100 – Dream job card

  For $150 – Junior Achievement mug

“I can’t afford to give right now. How else can I help?”

  Get Involved! Follow this link to learn what opportunities are available near you.

Thank You!
story_txt:
We are a group
of students at the University of Tennessee in the Haslam College of Business.
We are also members of Venture, a living learning community focused on
business. This semester we are taking English 255 Public Writing partnering
with Junior Achievement of East Tennessee to help raise awareness of the
organization in addition to the funds needed to help run BizTown. With your
help, we will be able to expand the BizTown program and teach more students the
importance of business in the world.
What
is Junior Achievement? 
  Junior Achievement is the largest
non-profit organization teaching kids about business,
economics, and free enterprise in the world. Their mission is “to
inspire young people to succeed in a global economy.” They partner with
volunteers, educators, and the business community to encourage youth to reach
their maximum potential. Specifically, the chapter in East Tennessee focuses on
17 counties, serving over 16,000 students. Junior Achievement of East Tennessee
(JAET) reaches students in three ways: classroom visits, job shadowing, and BizTown.
For more information about what Junior Achievement is and what they stand for,
visit their page
What is BizTown?
  BizTown is by far the most unique
experience offered by JAET. BizTown is a hands-on learning program that allows
students to run a miniature town for a day. As Chip Reed, President of the JAET
chapter, would say, “There is nothing like learning by doing.” Although these
kids aren’t old enough to vote or drive, they can operate their own businesses.
Students spend a whole day working together to help keep the town running
efficiently by keeping their businesses up and running through the skills they will
learn at the beginning of the program. They are able to learn how businesses
interact with each other to keep a community running smoothly through first-hand
experience.
Why do we need
to raise funds?
  There is a scarcity in BizTown! We
need supplies for each of the businesses to run smoothly. We will be allocating
all funds earned to restock supplies in each business. Examples of the supplies
needed include paper for the News
Sentinel mock business, electronic equipment for the entrepreneur station, stuffed
animals for the pet store, and much more! 
  If we are unable to reach our goal
of $1500, all of the money will still be allocated to BizTown for supplies.
JAET will prioritize what businesses need the most help with funding and will
be distributed to these stores accordingly.
What do you get?
  Not only do you get the satisfaction
of making a difference in a child’s life and helping them learn and grow, but
you get sweet perks too! 
  For $5 – Virtual High-Five
  For $10 – Gold Star
  For $25 – Shout out on Facebook
  For $50 – Haslam College of Business
pen
  For $75 – Pop-up bank
  For $100 – Dream job card
  For $150 – Junior Achievement mug
“I can’t afford
to give right now. How else can I help?”

to learn what opportunities are available near you.Thank You!

story:
Our Story

We are a group of high school students working together to design, build, program, and pilot a flying hexapod for one of our school projects. It will be designed and assembled from scratch, and we are going to need approximately five-thousand dollars in order to create a highly functional version of the concept. Most of that money will be spent on electronics (upwards of four-thousand dollars) due to their high cost, and the rest of it  will be going towards raw materials and manufacturing. If money allows, our team will be contacting professional machine shops to mill out CAD files of the HexaPodTer's parts in order to give it the highest possible adherence to design dimensions.

Once funding has been established, our team will be creating Bi-Weekly videos updating our backers on our progress in structural design concepts, as well as progress in the physical build. 

The HexaPodTer is going to be one of the first open-source projects of it's kind, and  fully documented build logs, designs, and our backer update videos will be available online, for free, upon the HexaPodTer's completion.

We are confident our success in making this project a reality will be able to serve as an inspiration to young engineers around the world, and the open-source nature of our work will be able to supplement valuable research and information on similar fields of robotics to anyone willing to read it.


Here are some of the preliminary CAD drawings of the leg structure. A completed arm can be seen animated at 1:00 in the video.

First Section:

First and Second section:

And the completed arm:
