story:
UPDATE

For phase-1 construction, we need $500,000 USD. Your contributions will make us to start to build this school to serve you all!

WHO WE ARE? 

ABOUT THE CAMPAIGNER

The campaigner and founder of - THE HUMAN VIBRATION Mr. Sridhar Rajasekaran, an Indian born, who's globally known to so many clients and readers. He started as a management consultant and then tapped out to research and personal counseling in the science of numerology, astrology, and feng shui at the age of 24 to various peoples and also to eminent personalities. From that moment itself his life path turns to be immersed towards the cosmic vibration and its supremacy. 

 He began the hunting of those subjects through various resources and highly structured his knowledge in this field. He encompasses through reading a number of volumes in this field and still doing his research in this field to give you all a single touch key to unfold your inner self. Today he's offering personal counseling in this field regarding all cases of universal connection to the human who are in penury of a divine spot. He yearns to assist while this higher energy work for him, it will also work for everyone on this globe.

 THE TEAM

As the campaigner himself the founding father and life coach of this school makes this project more viable to accomplish and his team members are more experienced in this field. The squad consists of management professional, herbal and Ayurveda doctors, yoga and meditation trainers, reflex therapist, etc. We are proud to receive such a fantastic team members to make this project a grand success to demonstrate it to the universe. 

WHY THE HUMAN VIBRATION?

Equally, we all undergone our school, college and university to nourish our knowledge and to apply it in our day to day life to become more productive. But, we may have not captured the opportunity to serve a school which trains the principle and practice of human spirit to be healthy, affluent, happy and successful living methodology. Thus, to execute so many dreams, we brainstormed the idea to build the school of inner awareness. With wonderful team strength it's potential for us to prepare this project a wonderful winner. The exclusive school for inner awareness to extend training in meditation, breathing techniques, mudra therapy, chakra therapy, affirmation therapy, herbal and Ayurveda therapy, reflex therapy, number therapy, etc. 

 The school was to be establish by the state of the art infrastructure to carry out a serene natural atmosphere to travel a happy inner journey to unlock the hidden fields of your liveliness. This school will offer training, practice and research for the aspiring hearts and minds to seek the real internal process. Hundreds can train and practice all at once in the larger meditation hall which was to be ahead to proceed. 

 The entire premise will draw you all to feel the real inner journey atmosphere with separate controls for all therapies, counseling, exercise, preparation, research, library, land scape, gardening, dinning hall, rooms and water features which adds more uniqueness to our school. THE HUMAN VIBRATION will definitely cause you totally feel the real universal vibration in thyself. The winner of this campaign will definitely answer you all and the future generation to make this world more beautiful and happier place. Exclusively eco friendly school to be build with the state of the art tourism place in southern part of India - TAMILNADU.  

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET?

As it's our long time vision to establish a school to serve the total human race, we expect your helping hands to support us to build this project alive. So, it all rest in your hearts to back us for this campaign. You all will feel the generosity of your contribution goes for a good cause to build a school of inner awareness, which will heal all your past, present situation into a happy and successful future journey. We aspire that you all will have the chance to visit, train and practice in our school as millions are going to occur.

To meet our vision into physical reality, we're asking your kind heart and hands to unite us to establish this school - THE HUMAN VIBRATION. All your valuable contributions will be widely applied to construct an amazing foundation which will serve you all and to make you all to feel the fulfillment of your internal voice. Additionally, you're going to give lives for so many trees, plants and human beings. Your generous love and backing will add more spirit for us to proceed forward to fix it a tremendous winner.

THE HUMAN VIBRATION project is an $9.45 million USD campaign. Everyone's contribution will make this project to become alive.

In this campaign, we're using flexible funding and we believe that your contributions will definitely make this project to meet the maximum funding. 

FEATURES OF OUR SCHOOL:

  • NATURAL OPEN SPACE MEDITATION PARK
  • TWO LARGE MEDITATION HALLS
  • SEVEN CHAKRA THERAPY CENTRE
  • REFLEX THERAPY CENTRE
  • NATURE CURE AND AYURVEDA CENTRE
  • NUMBER THERAPY CENTRE
  • ALPHA MIND POWER CENTRE
  • PERSONAL COUNSELING CENTRE
  • LIBRARY
  • LEARNING ROOMS
  • CHILDREN INNOVATION CENTRE (CHINOVA)
  • ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICE
  • DINNING HALL
  • ACCOMODATION ROOMS FOR TRAINEES AND DELEGATES
  • BEAUTIFUL LANDSCAPES, PARKS AND GARDEN
  • WATER FEATURES AND MANY MORE TO DO...

 THE ENTIRE FUND WILL BE UTILIZED FOR THE WORK AHEAD TO BE ACCOMPLISH:  

  • BUILDING CONSTRUCTION 
  • ELECTRICAL AND PLUMBING
  • FURNITURES AND FIXTURES
  • LIBRARY BOOKS
  • LIGHTNING
  • AUDIO & LCD PROJECTOR
  • ELECTRICAL BACKUP
  • ADMINISTRATIVE EQUIPMENTS
  • MEDITATION & YOGA MATERIALS
  • LANDSCAPING & GARDENING
  • ACCOMODATION ROOM ACCESSORIES
  • ADMIN EXPENSES, CAMPAIGN FEES, TAX AND PERKS    

 If the contribution crosses our limit, we will add more facilities like:

  • SOLAR POWER SYSTEM
  • AIR CONDITIONING
  • LIFT
  • HERBAL AND ORGANIC FARM
  • CHILDREN'S PARK
  • AEROBIC CENTRE
  • AYURVEDIC AND HERBAL SPA
  • INDOOR GAMES

We need your kind help to build this unique school of inner  awareness  

"THE HUMAN VIBRATION"

AMAZINGLY! YOUR PERKS

 

  

 

 

 THE HUMAN VIBRATION - HARD COVER BOOK

 

 TROPHY AND MEDAL FOR YOU!

 

 

YOUR KIND HEART GIVES ME A LIFE IN THIS UNIVERSE,

THANK YOU (YOUR NAME) 


 

THE IMPACT

Through dedication to his work in his internal search and practice, our campaigner had grown to realize that his goal in life is to get out the paramount in others. Through 15 years of research and experience in this field clears him to become the founding father of this school - THE HUMAN VIBRATION.

He's blessed to have the opportunity to work with so many people who have wanted to change in their lives and to ease them all on the way. His vision was to help you to connect the gap between where you are today and where you want to be and you will decidedly make the link between you and the universe. The inner journey of contemplation is a living process that will assist you to impress in advance of the façade of constraint. It can heal all your past and present conditions and tie you to a path of success and happy journey of your future.

His vision was to perform something useful for the masses in this world before he leave this planet. He wants to establish a school for inner growth to train all to become more successful and to lead a happy spirit. With your helping soul and contribution we will build this vision into physical shape to help the entire human vibration in near and future era of this domain. Without you it's impossible for us, but with your kind assistance, we can make this possible to suffice all human vibrations.

 RISK AND CHALLENGES

With our awesome team, we are confident to make this project a grand success through the indiegogo.com crowd funding platform. There may be many risks, obstacles and challenges in our journey to fulfill this vision. But, our team work, management skills, self realization and the overall experience of our founder will overcome all the stepping stones into the pinnacle of success. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We need your generous support and if you are unable to contribute to this campaign, but still you help us in others ways:

Kindly share our vision to the world through your social networks.

utilize the Indiegogo share tools to your family, relatives, friends, co workers, and beloved to make this campaign a plethora of success.

story:
Our Background  

For the last eight years, LEAP Science and Maths Schools has partnered with organizations around the world to provide teacher training and professional development opportunities in South Africa and abroad. In July 2015, we hope to unite these programs into one international platform dedicated to increasing the quality and quantity of teachers throughout the world: the Global Teachers Institute.

Our Vision

The Global Teacher’s Institute (GTI) wants to change the way we train teachers. International research shows that teacher quality is the most significant factor affecting educational outcomes. However, training programs often misinterpret this by overemphasizing skills and content, while overlooking the more personal dimensions that facilitate effective teaching. This creates teachers skilled in conveying content, but lacking the reflective capacity to understand the deeper purpose of their work.

To solve educational inequality, the GTI believes that teachers must not only focus on instructional practice and skills acquisition, but also on facilitating personal transformation and setting a deeper meaning for their work. In response, the GTI aims to empower student teachers, current faculty, school leaders, and education organizations globally by refocusing teacher training and professional development on ideas of consciousness development and social change. To accomplish this, the GTI integrates skills-based training with material specifically emphasizing personal awareness, student emotional needs, and social responsibility.

 

 

We aim to create educators who:

 

·Believe in open, honest engagement and having difficult conversations about the broader context of educational work.

·Prioritize self-awareness and self-reflection.

·Confront their personal beliefs about learning, culture, and achievement and consider the moral and political questions that are enmeshed within education.

·Frame their teaching practice through these reflections and understand its influence on their work. 

 

 

Why Is This Needed? 

 

  • South African Teacher Shortage of 15,000

To meet education demands, South Africa needs approximately 25,000 new teachers a year, but each year only 10,000 teachers meet the necessary qualifications to teach. 

  • Average South African Teacher Attrition Rate of Three Years

Teachers often cite a lack of professional development, mentorship and support as reasons for leaving the profession. 

 

Your Contribution Will:

·Expand our already existing student teacher training program to 1,000 trainees by 2019.

·Provide resources for our annual Aspiring Teacher's Summit, a three-day conference where teachers from around the world come together for an international exchange of best practices.

·Create a GTI website where curriculum and resources for our teacher education and professional development programs are available.

·Produce a short documentary video of our work.

·Help build an international community of educators dedicated to integrating personal transformation into their work. 

 

 

In Return, You'll Receive:

 

  • GTI/LEAP CD’s, postcards, and other paraphernalia 
  • Opportunities to participate in our workshops/conferences and meet our teachers personally
  • Invitations to our social events that connect people interested in global education
  • A chance to voice your support for educational programs driven by the goal of social change.    

Other Ways You Can Help:

  • Spread the word about our campaign on email and social media using Indiegogo's sharing tools. Like us on Facebook here: https://www.facebook.com/globalteachersinstitute?fref=ts
  • Ask your friends and family to make a donation, no amount is too small or insignificant
  •  Volunteer to present at our second annual Aspiring Teachers Summit:

         Email:  aspiringteachers@leapschool.org.za

  • Contact us directly to find out more about our work and how you can get involved.  

          http://leapschool.org.za/aboutleap/leap-future-leaders/global-teachers-       institute/

 

More About Us:

 

 

LEAP Science and Maths Schools is a leading learning organization which aims to drive education transformation in South Africa. We have a strong ten-year track record in providing quality education that equips young people from marginalized communities with the academic and life skills they need to succeed. LEAP currently operates six high schools educating 962 students in grades 8-12 in the Western Cape, Gauteng, and Limpopo areas of South Africa. Since 2007, our student teacher training program has trained 10% of each LEAP graduating class. 

 

 LEAP has partnered with educational organizations like the Buck Institute, Teach With Africa and others to collaborate in delivering our professional development programs. In 2009, LEAP co-founded the Bridge network which supports collaboration and innovation amongst leaders in education. In 2010, LEAP co-founded the South African Extraordinary Schools Coalition (SAESC), a network of low-fee and no-fee independent and public schools which provide access to high quality education for students living in marginalized communities.

LEAP currently operates six high schools educating 962 students in grades 8-12 in the Western Cape, Gauteng, and Limpopo areas of South Africa. Since 2007, our student teacher training program has trained 10% of each LEAP graduating class.   LEAP has partnered with educational organizations like the Buck Institute, Teach With Africa and others to collaborate in delivering our professional development programs. In 2009, LEAP co-founded the Bridge network which supports collaboration and innovation amongst leaders in education. In 2010, LEAP co-founded the South African Extraordinary Schools Coalition (SAESC), a network of low-fee and no-fee independent and public schools which provide access to high quality education for students living in marginalized communities.

story:
UPDATE:
We are so overwhelmed and grateful to all the community support we have received thus far! This is truly community supported education, and it means the world to us that you believe everyone should have access to enriching educational experiences, regardless of family background.

We have a new reach goal of $15,000! When we set our sights on $10K, that was the bare minimum we needed to simply run the program for girls we had already accepted. If we raise an additional $5,000 dollars, we will be able to: offer more scholarship funds to additional students, bring in guest teachers, who can enrich the program immensely, and have the funds to take students on field trips to visit local farms, permaculture sites, and witness firsthand this work happening in the real world. These funds would be immensely helpful in running a rocking first program, so please contribute, comment on the campaign, and send to your friends and networks!! THANK YOU SO MUCH!!

The Project

Spiral is a month-long, residential permaculture training intensive for young women, ages 15-18, held at Dig In Farm. These young women will live in community, learn to farm working with nature rather than against it, explore the connection between social and environmental justice, and graduate with a strong network of other young women working for a thriving and just food movement.*

The Spiral program has three main components:

1) Learning  permaculture to understand how  to farm with nature, rather than against it (thereby increasing biodiversity, mitigating climate change, spreading power into the hands of the many rather than the few, and offering tasty, healthy food for all people).

2) Uniting the struggle for environmental justice with social justice. Over the course of the month at Spiral, we will do a hands-on art-as-activism project in partnership with Mending Patriotism, a social practice multi-year art piece, exploring farm workers’ rights, immigration, and art, seeking to understand our role as farmers, activists, and change-makers in a globalized world.

3) Living and working in community with people and place. We will immerse ourselves in nature by living, cooking, and working outside, learning and practicing nonviolent communication, and re-casting the quotidian tasks of cooking, cleaning, and tending as sacred practices rather than busywork.

Through each these three components of Spiral, we will help grow and strengthen a network of empowered young women farmers and change-makers.

* Note: We are aware that gender identity is complicated, and hold space for any student who self-identifies as female to attend the program.

The Why

We believe a truly healthy, just food system is possible, and young women will lead the way there. Too often the environmental conversation stops at gloom and doom and leaves young people feeling depressed and dis-empowered. Using permaculture design along with nonviolent communication, the Spiral program will offer real solutions (and—importantly-- hands-on practice using those solutions!) that can help create a healthier, more just way of growing, sharing, and eating food. Already, seventy five percent of new organic farmers are women. (Huzzah!) We want to help grow this network from teen change-makers on up.  

The Need

We already have around twenty young women  who have applied to come live, work, and learn at Spiral! We are deeply committed to making this program accessible to young women from all economic backgrounds. Most of our applicants do not have the funds to pay for the program. By contributing to the project, you will directly help young women from all over the country, from all sorts of families and places, get the training they want to help create a truly healthy food system.

We need to raise at least $10,000 to offer financial support to the students who have already applied.  Your contributions will go directly to tuition support. Tuition covers housing, food, transportation costs, materials, insurance, and staffing. We need your support to break even while making the program just and accessible for all students.

If we don’t reach our entire goal, we will be able to offer aid only to a percentage of our program applicants. We will still direct the entirety of the funds to scholarship assistance, but we won’t be able to support all the young women who want to attend.

The Team

Our core team of teachers has over 25 years combined experience of leading high school students in experiential education. We have practiced permaculture, wilderness awareness, group facilitation, and radical social and environmental justice education across the country and globe. We have been fortunate to have educational and professional experiences that range from animal tracking at the Vermont Wilderness School to studying the theory of multiple intelligences with Howard Gardner at the Harvard School of Education; from permaculture teacher training at the Esalen Institute to the academic study of women in farming at Yale University; from building a farm at Colorado College to tending a large-scale citrus orchard in California. Importantly, we have all lived and worked together before (for years) at the Woolman Semester, another amazing school/farm/community in Northern California, focused on peace, social justice, and environmental sustainability. Thanks to our intense life/work combination at Woolman, the team has deep and strong patterns of communication and collaboration that will serve the Spiral project well.

Across all these experiences, we have come to believe that young people already have all the imagination, brilliance, and perseverance to create whatever they envision. We need only to support them in discovering who they already are and uncovering the strength they already have.

story:
The United Space School, coordinated by the Foundation for International Space Education (FISE), a courtesy of NASA, is a 2-week educational program that takes place every summer in Houston, bringing together up to 50 high school students from around the world to participate in various space-related activities, learn more about the space sciences and space exploration, go on field trips such as the Johnson Space Centre, and work together to complete the project: A Manned Mission to Mars! (To learn more, click here.)

Areeba, from Toronto, has been selected as one of the Canadian representatives to attend the USS 2015. Ever since a young age she loved everything to do with space and she dreamt of one day working at NASA or the Canadian Space Agency. She has always wished to participate in a space-related program as such. For her, this is a dream come true!

The fee for the USS is $1000 USD, and the airfare to travel to Houston from Toronto (and back) is estimated to be around $1000-$1300 USD. There are other smaller travel expenses as well.

Any donation is appreciated, thank you for helping to make her dream come true!

story:
The Problem

Refugees have to leave their home countries due to war, conflict and the lack of opportunities. While fleeing, they go through a variety of countries where they cannot find opportunities and move on with the dream to reach Europe or America. Uganda is a stable country in East Africa and a transition country for refugees. Uganda is home to one of the largest refugee camps in the world: Nakivale, where over 70.000 people live.

The refugees have fled mainly from Burundi, DR Congo, Somalia, Eritrea, Ethiopia and South Sudan and live in poverty without future prospects. The settlement was established in the 1950s and today over 80% of the inhabitants are below the age of 35. In Nakivale possibilities to go to school or take part in any kind or education or opportunities are almost non-existent . The youth has an enormous drive to be able to sustain themselves, generate income and create a dignified life by themselves, but the settlement only provides them with a small piece of land and the UNHRC hands out food rations. Many wait for resettlement to other countries but the chances are almost zero.

Uganda treats refugees as a problem, who need to be controlled and isolated from the rest of the society. Yet the young refugees have dreams and untapped talent. They lack the opportunities to unleash their potentials and create a dignified new life in Uganda.

Our Solution

click on the image for the USER EXPERIENCE MAP

A self-organized space for refugees, by refugees to create opportunites and jobs for themselves. If they can create income and a dignified life in Uganda for themselves, the refugees do not have to continue their journey to other countries.

In October 2016 we have prototyped OPPORTUNIGEE, the world's first self-organized entrepreneurship and Tech hub within the Nakivale refugee camp. We want to now take it to the next level for the refugees to create their own opportunities and jobs. We have build a house togther with the refugee community out of upcycled plastic bottles and the youth of Nakivale is running and administering it.

The space is open for everyone, owned and run by the refugees themselves. The space provides internet, tools, learning resources and tutorials on how to use the internet for research and the creation of projects. Design Thinking and the Lean Startup approach push the participants to test ideas and find solutions to the problems of the entire community through the creation of social enterprises.

There is huge potential for social entrepreneurship in the settlement because most basic needs, such as safe drinking water, are often not met. The goal is for the youth to create their own opportunities and their own jobs instead of passively waiting for help. Creating a life of dignity and peace in Uganda means the refugees do not need to continue their journey towards Europe or South Africa but actively build their lives in Uganda and contribute to Uganda’s economy instead of being perceived as a burden on the country.


“When a flower doesn't bloom you fix the environment in which it grows, not the flower.” - Alexander Den Heijer

Singing up on kiron, the refugees can even make use of the computers and internet provided to study accredited bachelor degrees from some of the world's best universities from Europe and the USA for free.

 

Who we are

We are a collaboration of three initiatives: NakivArt from the Nakivale Refugee Settlement Uganda, the Social Innovation Academy (SINA) from Uganda and Project DEFY from India.

NakivArt was started as a project in the Nakivale Refugee Settlement by a group of refugees under the lead of Patrick and Raphael Muvunga and Victor Turatsinze. They feld the Democratic Republic of Congo and have lived in the settlement for many years. Since 2015 they used art as a form for trauma healing for the children and youth of the camp, giving a space to draw, play, exchange, learn together and express themselves. Patrick, Raphael and Victor were invited to become scholars at the Social Innovation Academy (SINA), founded by Etienne Salborn from Germany, who is living in Uganda since 2006.

 

The Social Innovation Academy (SINA) is giving marginalized youth in Uganda an environment where they become social entrepreneurs and turn around their tragic life stories into catalysts for social change. At SINA the NakivArt-Team experienced and impersonated the unique SINA culture of empowerment and collaboration, while also having gone through training and have learned how to conduct trainings. They went through trainings for unlearning limiting believes and identifying opportunities with and for communities. They have experienced coaching for personal growth and unleashing potentials and have specialized in learning coaching techniques to be able to coach others and train others on the basics of coaching. They have further specialized in training and facilitation tools and are able to hold sessions empowering other youth and allow them to drive their own education. In early 2016 Etienne Salborn met Abhijit Sinha in Kampala, who is the founder of Project DEFY in India. They quickly realized that they have to work together, bearing a similar vision of transforming education giving the power to the people in order to drive their own curricula and create opportunities and jobs for themselves.

 

 

Project DEFY has successfully proven that is possible for youth to create and run their own learning spaces, where they design their own education and learn by developing projects out of interest. It has established two such spaces, that they call Nooks, in India. SINA has created an empowerment model which has shown remarkable success in allowing marginalized and disadvantaged youth to transform their lives and become social entrepreneurs. The NakivArt SINA scholars have taken on this model into the refugee settlement and started to make it their own. In October 2016, SINA supported NakivArt to build a house out of plastic bottles with the community of refugees in Nakivale. The space was finished on October 20th. On October 21st Etienne, Abhijit, Patrick Raphael, Victor and the NakivArt team of refugees all came together in Nakivale to start a first prototype of the self-organized learning space. The response was enormous and over 50 young refugees came to the space on the first day. The refugees have different nationalities and come from different backgrounds and religions but they share, learn, teach and create together, male and female alike.

 
What is needed
OPPORTUNIGEE has just started at the end of October 2016 and needs support to be able to sustain and grow. Running costs for electricity, the maintainance and replacement of simple tools and specific materials for prototyping social businesses have to be procured. The first project some opportunigees are working on is the creation of a social enterprise providing affordable biosand water filters to households on a micro-loan basis because safe drinking water in the camp is hardly available.
 
Electricity is cutting almost every day for many hours and preventing the youth to make use of the online resources. A small solar system and a power backup is needed. There are no internet cables available and internet has to be provided through the mobile network for 100 USD per month for a 256kbps connection. Apart from the house out of plastic bottles, a second space is available but lacks flooring and the mud bricks have to be plastered to protect the building from the rain.

 

With 7.500 USD OPPORTUNIGEE will be sustained for the entire year 2017 and is able to provide the basic needs to the youth refugees to be able to start projects and social enterprises, which will sustain themselves and the space in the long run. With more than 7.500 USD we will grow the space to accommodate more than the current 50 youth, who are coming every day. Our bigger vision is to create more OPPORTUNIGEE spaces in Nakivale and other refugee camps and refugee settlements in Africa and around the world.

Your support is needed!

story:
Pre-fund the 2017 SHG Harvest Party!

Hi Everyone,

The SHG Harvest Party is an annual event filled with creative costumes, games, activities, and lots of time to visit with friends, old and new.  This year's party will be held on October 29th from 2pm-5pm.

Rather than selling tickets, we use donations to cover the costs of the party. This crowd-funding website helps us raise the donations.

We are now starting fundraising for this year's party. The system is simple enough. If we raise enough money, we get to have the Harvest Party. If we do not raise the money, we do not have the party, and everyone keeps the money they contributed/pledged. 

Recommended contributions are $30 per family. Larger contributions help us cover the costs of those who cannot afford to donate. 

There are many opportunities to volunteer your time and support our community at this event. Please contact Andrea at msmuppet@gmail.com for more information.

Thank you,

Your Harvest Party Team (Andrea Shullaw, Kristina Bulajewski, Sandee Lium,  and Scott Steinhorst)

story:
Hello, my name is Leena and I am reaching out to the dreamers, the believers, the supporters, and wild-hearted humans who believe as I do, that whatever makes your life beautiful, is essential.

     I have been running Creative - Therapeutic photography workshops for 7 years. It is a moving, helpful, challenging and inspiring course that expands the way participants see the world and themselves. Along the way, participants improve their camera skills, learn new techniques, learn to develop new ways of seeing, take part in innovative photography tasks and assignments. It also includes building one`s self-esteem and transforming one`s inner turmoil into art. Participants experience the healing nature of photography.

     I am not a mental health professional but I am a photographer/ author/ artist who has a unique approach to using photography in a therapeutic way.

     I discovered Therapeutic photography years ago after my divorce. It was a time of fear, frustration, of being lost.  I was looking for Hope, Self-identity, Self-confidence and Myself. So, I started to search for myself from where I believe is the beginning - in nature.

     I found how fragile a human being is...everybody has those moments, but for me as a photographer I let my camera capture them. I fell in love with nature, because I was so pleased about what I hadn't previously noticed. The ripening of berries, how the river freezes and how it thaws. How buds thrive.

     The seasons changed and so did I. Piece after piece I put myself together. And I found peace and freedom to be myself.  And you know? That is a lot...

     Only later on I attended a Symposium organised by the Finnish Phototherapy Association in Finland, what was my first formal introduction to Therapeutic photography but I already had experienced the healing nature of photography.

     The reality is that nowadays, many are crying out for help and support, compassion and understanding. To protect ourselves, we hide our truth. But the more walls we build, the more isolated we feel.  I have been developing skills and expertise in creative methods but I realised that I can do more good and generate more joy in this world if I can work with Points of You® methods and tools which are based on PhotoTherapy.

     I believe that Points of You® Trainer Certification Program will give me the best opportunity to reach the most people in the most effective ways with the many tools I have mastered over the years and the new ones. This method will help me effectively apply my skills to individual and group work, witness the amazing results and find our way back to true health and happiness.

     It will also help me realise my coaching goals faster, with more clarity and confidence.I am interested in expanding my toolkits and introducing a new dimension into my work. The Points of you Coaching game is an enjoyable thought provoking game that allows us to relieve old patterns by taking time out and looking at life from different perspectives. It is a unique experience of inspiration, learning and development.

     The Coaching Game has turned into a valuable and practical tool for professionals such as therapists, life and business coaches, counsellors and facilitators.

     Points of You® Trainer Certification Program is ICF Accredited. The participants will be facilitated by Efrat Shani, Co-creator of Points of You® and earn 44.75 CCEU's.

     Here`s what I need to make it happen:

3900 Euro - Points of You® Trainer Certification Program and travel expenses.

     It is never easy to ask for help, but I am grateful that I have a beautiful community I can reach out to. Thank you all so so much for your generosity, love and support in helping me fulfil my dream and be an active, contributing member to this incredible human world!

     Even if you are unable to back the project, sharing it on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram is hugely appreciated. (There are sharing buttons on the page!)

I believe in Love. Love can change the world.

Leena

Testimonials:

Geoff: " We laughed, we cried, we shared, we cared and we got creative. If you want a similar experience then take the plunge and sign up for Leena’s next course. You won’t need a big posh camera and you certainly won’t need advanced technical knowledge. But you will need time and commitment to a weekly session with accompanying homework. You will also need a mind that’s open to new thoughts and ideas and you’ll definitely need a real passion for photography.”

Nerissa: “Don't be daunted by technical ability as this course is centred around creativity and ways of seeing. To get the most out of the course you'll need time, effort an eagerness to explore! It truly has changed my outlook and drive and the saying that good things must come to an end is apt in this case. You really won't regret taking part in this course, enjoy!"

Carla: “I appreciated Leena's straightforward style, humour and her passion for what she does. I no longer feel like the novice I was. I look forward to continuing on my photography journey and would recommend anybody to say "yes" and step a little outside of your comfort zone."

Sarah: “I really really enjoyed the course, it's opened my eyes to a whole new side of creative photography. I enjoyed being pushed with the homework and having to present to the group, which initially was very daunting but rapidly felt like gained confidence. The course helped me deal with emotions that might have otherwise been left trapped up.”

Laura: "This course teaches you about the kind of things you don't find in textbooks, she opens doors that evolve your own creativity, and the homework is challenging, exciting, and personally rewarding. I wholly recommend it."

Dan: "Leena's series of workshops is an engaging and inspiring course that pushed me into new ways of seeing and thinking about how and why I take photographs. This is not a technical course - expect no direction or instruction on how to use a camera or post-process your photos - this course will help you to look and to see, introduce the work of other artists, and challenge you to take photographs you may not have taken otherwise."

Sarah: `This course came at exactly the right time for me, and I can't recommend it highly enough. As a photographer, I spend most of my time taking photos for other people. I haven't felt brave enough to turn the camera on myself before now, and the course has challenged me to try new things with my work in a safe and inclusive environment. It's given me the space and courage to try something new."

 

VIDEO for this campaign was made by amazing and talented Sarah Mason Photography!

http://www.sarahmasonphotography.co.uk/

MUSIC for video: Euan Atkinson

 

About me:

I am Latvian photographer who uses photography to tell my very personal stories. I believe in translating emotion into images, feeling and experiencing life through photography, seeking and questioning, trying to see behind the visual reality. I’m interested in personal, self-experienced stories. For me, Photography is much more than prints. The camera is a mirror in my life. When you put your own story into the pictures I believe that something happens and resonates with other people.

Born 1981, Latvia. Live in Hebden Bridge, UK. I have graduated from Riga Photographer School in Latvia, later participated in International Summer school of Photography. Exhibited at the ISSP 2013 Group Exhibition, Photo series „My life without me”, Kuldiga, Latvia.  Exhibition Photo series “Fragile” 2015, Leeds, UK.
story_txt: Hello, my name is Leena and I am reaching out to the dreamers, the believers, the supporters, and wild-hearted humans who believe as I do, that whatever makes your life beautiful, is essential.     I have been running Creative - Therapeutic photography workshops for 7 years. It is a moving, helpful, challenging and inspiring course that expands the way participants see the world and themselves. Along the way, participants improve their camera skills, learn new techniques, learn to develop new ways of seeing, take part in innovative photography tasks and assignments. It also includes building one`s self-esteem and transforming one`s inner turmoil into art. Participants experience the healing nature of photography.     I am not a mental health professional but I am a photographer/ author/ artist who has a unique approach to using photography in a therapeutic way.     I discovered Therapeutic photography years ago after my divorce. It was a time of fear, frustration, of being lost.  I was looking for Hope, Self-identity, Self-confidence and Myself. So, I started to search for myself from where I believe is the beginning - in nature.     I found how fragile a human being is...everybody has those moments, but for me as a photographer I let my camera capture them. I fell in love with nature, because I was so pleased about what I hadn't previously noticed. The ripening of berries, how the river freezes and how it thaws. How buds thrive.     The seasons changed and so did I. Piece after piece I put myself together. And I found peace and freedom to be myself.  And you know? That is a lot...     Only later on I attended a Symposium organised by the Finnish Phototherapy Association in Finland, what was my first formal introduction to Therapeutic photography but I already had experienced the healing nature of photography.     The reality is that nowadays, many are crying out for help and support, compassion and understanding. To protect ourselves, we hide our truth. But the more walls we build, the more isolated we feel.  I have been developing skills and expertise in creative methods but I realised that I can do more good and generate more joy in this world if I can work with Points of You® methods and tools which are based on PhotoTherapy.     I believe that Points of You® Trainer Certification Program will give me the best opportunity to reach the most people in the most effective ways with the many tools I have mastered over the years and the new ones. This method will help me effectively apply my skills to individual and group work, witness the amazing results and find our way back to true health and happiness.     It will also help me realise my coaching goals faster, with more clarity and confidence.I am interested in expanding my toolkits and introducing a new dimension into my work. The Points of you Coaching game is an enjoyable thought provoking game that allows us to relieve old patterns by taking time out and looking at life from different perspectives. It is a unique experience of inspiration, learning and development.     The Coaching Game has turned into a valuable and practical tool for professionals such as therapists, life and business coaches, counsellors and facilitators.     Points of You® Trainer Certification Program is ICF Accredited. The participants will be facilitated by Efrat Shani, Co-creator of Points of You® and earn 44.75 CCEU's.     Here`s what I need to make it happen:3900 Euro - Points of You® Trainer Certification Program and travel expenses.     It is never easy to ask for help, but I am grateful that I have a beautiful community I can reach out to. Thank you all so so much for your generosity, love and support in helping me fulfil my dream and be an active, contributing member to this incredible human world!     Even if you are unable to back the project, sharing it on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram is hugely appreciated. (There are sharing buttons on the page!)I believe in Love. Love can change the world.LeenaTestimonials:Geoff: " We laughed, we cried, we shared, we cared and we got creative. If you want a similar experience then take the plunge and sign up for Leena’s next course. You won’t need a big posh camera and you certainly won’t need advanced technical knowledge. But you will need time and commitment to a weekly session with accompanying homework. You will also need a mind that’s open to new thoughts and ideas and you’ll definitely need a real passion for photography.”Nerissa: “Don't be daunted by technical ability as this course is centred around creativity and ways of seeing. To get the most out of the course you'll need time, effort an eagerness to explore! It truly has changed my outlook and drive and the saying that good things must come to an end is apt in this case. You really won't regret taking part in this course, enjoy!"Carla: “I appreciated Leena's straightforward style, humour and her passion for what she does. I no longer feel like the novice I was. I look forward to continuing on my photography journey and would recommend anybody to say "yes" and step a little outside of your comfort zone."Sarah: “I really really enjoyed the course, it's opened my eyes to a whole new side of creative photography. The course helped me deal with emotions that might have otherwise been left trapped up.”Laura: "This course teaches you about the kind of things you don't find in textbooks, she opens doors that evolve your own creativity, and the homework is challenging, exciting, and personally rewarding. story:
The Communication Academy & why we need your help

The Communication Academy was founded by Dr. Rick Rodrick and Janet Weir, M.S.,  to provide affordable communication lessons for anyone who knows they could communicate better (in short, pretty much everyone).

  • Dr. Rick Rodrick and Janet Weir are seasoned educators. Together they have more than 40 years of communication teaching and coaching experience. In addition, their continuing involvement in non-academic activities has given them the ability to tailor their teaching to a broad audience with many different personal experiences.
  • "Our passion is helping others learn to communicate more effectively. For many years, our students and friends have encouraged us to find a way to bring our classroom lessons to a broader audience. We believe we have unique insights into communication that go beyond what most people have learned. Through our videos we are going to provide original content based on our understanding that communication is not just a way for information to get from one person to another but also as an ongoing process of creating and shaping the world we live in."
  • While each video and video series is small, the lessons will be large. A significant part of our day involves communicating with others. Communication problems create outcomes that are disappointing (or just plain bad), create extra work, or just make life miserable. Everyone can benefit from communication lessons. Our experience is that well-crafted communication lessons improve peoples lives in immediate and lasting ways. They can't solve every problem or make any of us perfect communicators (there's actually no such thing) but it will make things easier!

What We Need & What You Get

We could just shoot some video (we even have a fancy camera) and place it on the web as we shot it. Unfortunately unedited content is not what most people want in their online lessons. Unedited video is fine for a report on your granddaughter's dance recital or your BFF's raft trip down the Colorado. We aim for more. We want to create high quality, affordable lessons that you and others want to watch, so editing is an absolute necessity.

  • As communication professionals we know how to edit video. Unfortunately, though, video editing requires a reasonably powerful computer. That's where your contribution comes in. We are planning to raise $600. With the funds raised we will purchase a computer that can edit video quickly enough to take on the task efficiently. The $600 will also allow us to purchase video editing software that is powerful enough for the task (we plan to use Cyberlink's Power Director software). We plan to use a local computer sales and service company (probably Enu Inc.) to build a dedicated video editing computer. By building a computer rather than buying one "off-the-rack" we will get maximum return on your contribution.
  • We want you to experience what you are supporting. Everyone who makes a $25 or higher contribution will receive two contributor's only communication lessons! We're sure you'll find these videos beneficial.
  • Of course we hope to achieve our entire goal amount. If we don't, however, we will combine what we have raised with our own personal funds and get an adequate computer. Not our first choice, of course, but rest assured that any contribution you make will move us one step closer to producing and distributing high-quality, affordable, and insightful lessons. These videos will be valuable internet content.

The Campaign Outcome

Video Production has become quite straight-forward and we have the background to film and edit creative and effective lessons. Unfortunately for us, while semi-retirement does give us time, it doesn't come with any spare cash. That's where you and this indiegogo campaign come in. We need a new computer. Our present processing power is simply not sufficient to edit video. The $600 we raise from this campaign will provide us with a dedicated video computer and reasonably powerful video editing software. We have the rest of the equipment we need so this $600 will allow to bring powerful and useful communication lessons to anyone with internet access.

Risks & Challenges

Of course we don't know that people will flock to the opportunity for affordable communication lessons. We do know that people want to communicate more effectively. We do know that communication understanding and skills can be effectively presented in a video format. Most of all, we know that we have a passion for helping people communicate. With this knowledge we are confident about our product.

  • So the biggest hurdle is probably getting the word out. Fortunately, our backgrounds in communication include work with campaigns. The Communication Academy campaign will concentrate word of mouth promotion with social media. Of course that is what seemingly every web project plans to do. We believe that the benefit people receive from our lessons, and their affordable price (we are working from a price point of $100 for a series of three lessons) will promote word of mouth. We plan to provide people who purchase lessons with opportunities to provide feedback to us and opportunities to share their value with others who are interested,
  • Before our first lessons are released we will create a Facebook page, web page, Twitter account and other social media platforms. These platforms will be designed as a location for testimonials and a source for information about lessons as they near release.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute we need your help. If you think (or know) our campaigns will have value, share the word about this indiegogo campaign (https://igg.me/at/CommAcad). The more people who hear about our campaign the sooner we can be teaching and releasing lessons. Indiegogo makes sharing information about this campaign easy with their share tools. We would appreciate any support in spreading the word. This idea has been percolating in our minds for a while now. With your help we can get it out of our minds and out on the net. Thanks from Rick and Janet!
